title: One of the finest examples of cinematography.
author: sagnikacharyya
text:
A film which shows the slums of Rio, the society, mentality ethos of the Brazilian society and culture from a common man's point of view. Nothing could be more connected to reality. Based on true events,Fernando Meirelles has done a stellar job potraying the drug cartels and business going on added with the corruption and media fighting to grab a piece of this for their individual survival.
The stunning cinematography keeps it as close to reality as possible, keeps you glued to the screen the whole time. You develop a sense of empathy for the characters given their natural performances.
And you leave with a sense of Brazilian culture and society that is prevalent around those parts of the country.
A must watch for every film lover.

title: GOD OF CINEMA
author: umeshshrikant
text: A rustic crime genre handled with gruesome reality. amazingly treated and a well driven craft. how many times you watch it, you will always find it intriguing.

title: I mean... it's a Brazillian film about Brazillian stuff.
author: nathanstitt
text: To put it simply, the cinematography was meh, the editing was good meh, the narrative was alright meh and we shouldn't be licking Meirelles' balls and saying it's an "enlightening spectacle" just because it highlighted typically unreported-on foreign problems.

title: Intense Story - City of God
author: jacquelinempezan
text: Meirelles does not prepare his audience for the cyclic violence and unending tragedy within the film with the name City of God. Meirelles, however, wastes no time to force his audience into the violent and dangerous slums of Brazil. From the beginning of the film, the audience experiences an array of cinematographic techniques from high contrast lighting to non-diegetic sounds and narration. The reality of Brazilian culture, apart from the highly trafficked tourist areas of Rio, is established in this film. This film does an excellent job of highlighting the extreme poverty within Brazil with the diegetic sounds of traffic and clashing knives used to represent violence. Non-diegetic narration from the main character, Rocket, establishes some character security, for the audience, along with highlighting his importance. By the end of the film, I found myself enthralled in the unraveling events of Rocket's life. The sounds in this film were nothing less of grotesque and chaotic and greatly attributed to the visual story. The opening scene is the first of many instances throughout the film, where Meirelles attempts to make his audience uncomfortable. In my opinion, this film brought awareness to the public about the brutality in the city of god. The samba music does an exceptional job of sweeping the audience away and plunging them into Rocket's (the main character) world. He does this to note the significant moments within the film and ensures that the audience does as well. I was captivated by the life and death, the rise and fall, of each of the characters and often found myself anxiously anticipating their fates. Meirelles's storytelling masterfully brings awareness to the reality of the City of God to those who do not recognize the reality of it.

title: Brutally truthful and incredibly made
author: jmugg-22428
text:
City of God shows the brutal and honest lives of people living in Cidade de Deus on the outskirts of Rio de Janiero. Over the course of several decades, we see the growth of gangs and drug cartels in the city. The film, based on a true story, is told by Rocket, a young man trying to become a photographer who documents the violence in the City of God.
The film draws you in with excellent cinematography and use of sound. Part of what makes the movie seem so literal is the use of ambient sound. The shouts of people in the city, the noise of vehicles passing, and the occasional sounds of violence give the film an extra level of realism. The narration by Rocket also adds an interesting layer. They way he starts at the eventual climax of the film, then returns to tell how things began gives it a story telling feel, as if Rocket is explaining how things got to this point. When new characters are introduced, the narration will tell their names, but explains that they will become more important later, making sure that the audience keeps them in mind for later. The sound use in City of God makes the film the narrative masterpiece that it is.
Another part of the movie that makes it feel more real is the cinematography. The quick, jerking cuts during action and more even shots during slower parts gives the film a documentary style feel, as if the camera is a person experiencing the brutal day-to-day action of the film. When situations become tense, framing of the scene tightens, begins cutting faster, and build great suspense for action. When the film slows down, the shots become more stable and lets the audience take in the story.
City of God is one of the best films about the struggle of people in lower status. Honest and extremely brutal, it is a must see for anyone interested in realistic films.

title: Rio In Ways You Never Knew Existed
author: nessnekkio
text: Think to yourself for a moment this question. What chance do children have of succeeding while living a life of poverty and criminal influence? Almost slim to none. City of God lets you know right away given the hard life in the Brazilian slums that almost no children in the film can live an honest life without the temptation of being engulfed by a life of crime. The character Rocket, the non-diegetic narrator of the film who is a wannabe photographer that got his wish of becoming a full-scale photographer was still involved within the drug dealing culture of the slums as he watches his brother and close friends die one by one because of greed, power, and very bloody money. Because the director's choose non-professional actors that actually live in the slums in Brazil, every actor portrayed a chillingly accurate representation of criminal hierarchies and gang culture. One scene specifically involves a child expressing his manliness by describing what he sees adults doing around him, which is taking drugs, robbing, and owning a firearm. Which speaks volumes into letting you know the sad realization that these children are doomed to repeat and replicate the violence and gang warfare they are so accustomed to.

title: you'll never buy another gram of coke...
author: dwyerbiz
text: no movie better explains the drug trade in Rio and what it does to its society -- from macho teens to corrupt police to even eleven year old kids . You won't believe what this one kid admits to doing, as if he were describing a cool video game. The movie was unbelievably good, but the special features were even better. we stayed up until 5am and couldn't turn it off. one of the most inspiring pieces of work i have ever experienced, both in film or in literature. I work at customs and this has served as an excellent reference for my work. If you use cocaine and you see this movie you will probably feel so guilty you won't even need to go on rehab, you'll just dump the crap down the toilet and join the peace corps or something. i'm serious, this movie will affect you.

title: City of God - the power of diegetic sound
author: rhysalexanderatay
text:
The diegetic sounds at the start of the film allow the viewer to quickly learn the high tempo and intense nature of the film. The overlapping sounds and inability to focus on one simple environmental noise, as well as the fast cutting between camera shots, clearly shows the viewer that they are about to view a high action movie.
The film does contain many points of non-diegetic audio throughout through its use of narration to explain all of the characters and allow the viewer to keep up with the pace of the film as it moves through all of the characters different stories. At some points in the film non-diegetic music is also used to contrast the highly explosive action scenes with much more calm scenes. The music provides a powerful contrast into the two sides of some of the characters lives with the slow and passionate side, against the wild and intense lifestyle they live.
Many of the scenes throughout the film appear to have very naked sound, however many minor sounds also appear to be amplified. This is effective as it could suggest the alert nature of the characters due to the situations that they are in. Their position in life means that they must pay attention to everything and all noises in case they are signals or warnings. Silence is used very rarely in the film too, which further pushes the intensity of their lifestyle and highlights that they are never at peace in the City of God.

title: Stuning
author: mattcarlson-96710
text: City of God shows the brutality of living in the outskirts of RIo De Janeiro. Throughout the film you see the growth of crime and drug dealing through the years and this shown by a photographer named Rocket who wants to tell the city's story. One of the parts of the movie that makes it so realistic is the audio with the sounds of city life and then the different pictures of the city really lay out the setting but also you can hear and see the crime and violence taking place. Throughout the movie you are drawn to the debilitating crime and how it affects people's livelihood. This film has a real sense of realism to it and it could be disturbing to watch at some points because of the violence. But the fact that this is done by a handheld camera it makes it even more realistic.

title: A Portuguese masterpiece.
author: elad-6
text: Even though I'm a guy who doesn't like watching movies whose speech is in languages other than English/Hebrew, I had no problems watching this intense Portuguese masterpiece, with subtitles of course. ;)

title: Spoiler Alert
author: abigailckobal
text: I am not going to say I hated City of God, because editing wise, there were some really great things. However, this would not be a film I would watch again. Two things that led to my overall negative feelings of the film were the plot and the overall look. I found myself confused throughout the film's plot and the quality of the film seemed poor such as the graininess. At times, the plot did not make a lot of sense for me, and the handheld camera techniques added to this feeling of anxiety and confusion. To me the plot did not make sense at times and I noticed the camera would be shaky or a little bit messy. To me, it looked and reminded me of a low-budget film. I found out that the budget for this film was $3.3 million USD which might seem like a lot, but even lower budget film ranges from $70-90 million (Parlay Studios). However, one could argue that it makes the movie feel more authentic to the subject matter and the setting. The movie uses some editing techniques that I found to be really great. The transitions between scenes were excellent. My favorite scene was when the two boys were in the tree in the beginning and sweat fell onto the leaf. The droplet of sweat falls and the scene transitions from that to a fish about to be eaten. There is definitely a metaphor about how these boys are "swimming with the big fish" after committing this big heist. It was just so beautifully done. The film used lots of diegetic sounds. The three top sounds that the movie used the most were screams, music, and gunshots. The music really added a sense of lightheartedness at times through the film. My favorite was when they had played Kung Fu Fighting by Carl Douglas. Overall, even though I would not watch this film again, I think it did a great job showing the story of what happened in the Slums.

title: Greatest and most inspirational movie ever!!!
author: SmellyNapalm99
text: City of God is a bloody, exciting thrill as much into the life of a "favela" as it is into the lives of the youths who inhabit it. Although the bulk of the movie narrates the all-out turf wars between two rival drug dealers, the story is told with the energy, liveliness and enthusiasm of a child's tale, somehow managing to leave us hope amongst the corpses as the credits roll.

title: The most incredible film
author: Adam_the_brave
text: I was very sceptical when I first put this DVD in my player and began the film, not because I hadn't heard that the film was brilliant but because i had heard the film was all in sub titles. Now the idea of a fantastic film for me is one where u get totally drawn in and so immersed in the film yet I believed that i wouldn't be able to do this if i was having to read to understand the plot. I couldn't of been any further incorrect. This film is amazing. The plot, the shots, the camera, the direction, the script, the acting absolutely everything about this film is very very impressive and from a media student point of view the editing was of such a high standard that i personally hadn't witnessed before. I agree totally that the film is shocking violent and brutal yet i think anything less and this wouldn't of been the film that it is. The shock factor is only a shock to us as we don't experience situations like this, yet in the setting from which the film is shot from it is common everyday practise. I think one of the most successful aspects of this film is the fact that it sticks true fully to what life really is like in the Brazilian slums, the temptation is clearly there for over exaggerated crimes and police chases yet the temptation is not pursued. All in all i think that this is a truly fantastic movie and one which en captures its audience and forces you to take notice. If you haven't watched this film do so and if u have watched this film watch it again its just as amazing second time over.

title: Godly Work of Brazilian Cinema
author: ReflexAlex
text: Having heard seemingly nothing about this movie besides it's high praise and rating prior to watching it, I can say I've been very much pleasantly surprised by what a bonanza of Brazilian film making this is!

title: A South American Masterpiece
author: CortlandHill
text: This movie was beyond amazing, any and everyone should watch it! The journey that viewers are taken on via the main character is mind blowing... this movie is literally like bringing a dope book to life! Easily one of the greatest films I've ever seen. Also, the way the film crew takes you back the era of the movie is awesome. Before you watch this movie make sure you go to the restroom because you will NOT want to pause or stop this one.

title: Well Directed, horrific Eye opener!!!
author: Scottys3k
text: This film was 1 of my first foreign subtitled films that i have ever seen in the cinema... I am usually quite sceptical about these types of films, as i feel that they seem 2 take your viewing off what is happening in the film

title: Film was a great film showing you the ins and outs of a gang war but......
author: christianjuns
text: I do not see any creative genius in it at all. What am I saying? the director took the same approach to this film from another great American director, his name is Martin Scorsese in Goodfellas. Why was this film not as critically acclaimed internationally as this film? It had the same approach, all narrative from the main character, both the films had that one guy who always seemed like the obnoxious ring leader, both movies were based on a true story, both films were made into a movie from a book, both had a sick ending plot, both told the story from the middle, beginning, and then to the end. this film my have been influenced by Martin, but do not compare it to American films saying that this is fresh and new and something we could never produce.

title: In the top five of all time
author: brucethomson-26510
text: Without a doubt, this movie is a towering achievement. It hits you like a freight train with its wholly unique form of style, brutality and general detail in the appalling lives of a group of people who choose very different life choices. It also shows how privileged most of us are compared to people who have to steal and shoot their way in order to survive. 11 out of 10.

title: Flawless
author: znmo
text: This movie could very possibly be the best movie I have ever seen. There is seriously not one flaw to this movie and plus, this movie has nearly everything that could possibly make a movie great.

title: What is the message here?
author: vavigof
text: One of the taglines for City of God is 'Fight and you'll never survive. Run and you'll never escape'. Even though the film emphasises that a life of crime is inevitable in Cidade de Deus, the fact that its narrator survives without blood on his hand may be its ultimate triumph.

title: Best of Brazil
author: lukas-arg
text: The movie is just great! From the plot, the characters and the social context, everything is spotless. The story is well-defined. The director knows his stuff. One hand washes the other. Bart are you awake? YES! Take out the trash! Maradona Starts the left lane, and avoids an English ... But instead simply start your rabbit head Pepito! Hey how you doing'? good rate pa 'enjoy. The house is in order. Lets get it started. See you later alligators! On the bonus DVD, it is revealed that the only professional actor with years of filming experience was Matheus Nachtergaele, who played the supporting role of Carrot.[1] Most of the remaining cast were from real- life navels, and in some cases, even the real-life City of God Havel itself. According to Meirelles, amateur actors were used for two reasons: the lack of available professional black actors, and the desire for authenticity. Meirelles explained: "Today I can open a casting call and have 500 black actors, but just ten years ago this possibility did not exist. In Brazil there were three or four young black actors and at the same time I felt that actors from the middle class could not make the film. I needed authenticity." Beginning about 2000, about a hundred children and young people were hand-picked and placed into an "actors' workshop" for several months. In contrast to more traditional methods (e.g. studying theater and rehearsing), it focused on simulating authentic street war scenes, such as a hold-up, a scuffle, a shoot-out etc. A lot came from improvisation, as it was thought better to create an authentic, gritty atmosphere. This way, the inexperienced cast soon learned to move and act naturally.

title: This is a new crime masterpiece
author: halixog
text: Lil Ze and his gang have fun chasing a runaway chicken in a Rio favela called Cidade de Deus "City of God". Chicken comes to Rocket with a camera. Memories of the 60s of the last century tell the story of Rocket, who becomes a photographer for his friends. Lil Ze and his best friend Benny grow up to be the city's crime bosses. There is Carrot, who is a crime leader who is tolerant of Benny, and Knockout Ned, who has turned his back on crime.

title: Freaking Awesome
author: kdogg567
text: This movie makes almost every other movie I've seen for a long time seem pointless. So intense, so perfectly crafted, absolutely ubelievable. This is truly filmmaking at its very best. Every frame is necessary, and every frame is perfect. To just talk about it is not to do it justice. Go see it.

title: Poetry in motion (like a speeding bullet)
author: niglees
text: This is simply an incredible film. One of the best films I've seen in a long time. It's quick and has very diverse and unique characters. The shots in every scene is marvelous.  This film takes a depth into third world gang activities and some life style. It is just extraordinary, point blank. The story line and the other between stories are just captivating. The violence might turn some folks off but I definitely pull through it.  This is flick is definitely in my Top 5.              4 1/2 out of 5

title: a great movie
author: mikeknight456
text: This movie is magic. If you watch it, it won't disappoint you. From beginning to end we watch as these kids grow up in the worst conditions this planet has to offer. Just as they found a way out, the world they live in refuses to let them leave and thus they become victims of the environment. Tragic!

title: One of the most unique movies I have seen this decade.
author: michaeljonesy
text: City of God is a brilliant film in every sense of the word, perfectly constructed, with an effortless sense of style and a hard hitting sense of realism hammering home an important social message.

title: INTENSE MOVIE THAT WILL OPEN YOUR EYES
author: ntzanis
text: I Saw This Movie At The 2002 Afi Fest In Hollywood California And I Must Say That I Had No Idea What To Expect From This Movie. I Knew Nothing Of It Before I Saw It. For American Movie audiences This Movie Mirrors Training Day In That You Have Movie Makers Walking Directly Into A War Zone In Order To Give The Viewer The Authentic Reality Of Whets Going On In These 2 Very Different Places. Although That's About Where The Similarities End. City Of God May Over Expose The Viewer To The Degree Of Violence That Inhibits The People Of These Towns. Especially The Role Of The Children As Victims And Protagonists. There Are Many Scenes That Seem To Freeze Time As You Watch Them. The Images Of Children Killing Other Children May Be To Honest For American Audiences. The Beauty Of This Film Is How It Is Able To Make You Feel Good While Never Allowing The Tension Of The What The Movie Is Really About To Escape Your Mind. It Takes An Open-Minded Person To Appreciate This Movie. Amorres Perros Came To Mind As I Watched City Of God. However What May Limit City Of God To The Level Of Amorres Perros Is That We Don't Ever Meet And Connect With Someone In These Town Is A Complete Victim. Someone Who Isn't Taking Part. However You Will Have To See The Movie To Judge For Yourself.....

title: Amazing
author: Elbundo
text: This film is, in every way, one of the greatest achievements in modern cinema. Being one of my all time favorite films i think this film is beautiful and heart breaking at the same time. I have never been to the City of God, but i have been told it portrays it with such accuracy that it is hard to believe, this fact only adds to my love of this film. The unknown actors add to the story and portray their characters beautifully, with me not finding a single fault in the acting, directing, editing and producing. This film should be seen by every person who calls themselves a movie lover, missing it will only be missing out on a truly amazing film.

title: Contain my opinion about the movie.
author: b3mbboy
text: In Brazil in the 1960's there was a place called the City of God. In the movie the Trio robs motels and gas trucks for something to do and a quick way to make some cash. Younger kids watch them because they want to be apart of the Trio but the older kids wouldn't let them. Lil Ze went in and killed everybody in there thus getting his taste of the bad seed. In the 1970's, Lil Ze has grown up and took over his former comrades and now he owns the city. He causes violence and fear as he wipes out rival gangs without mercy. His best friend Bene is the only one to keep him on the good side of sanity. Rocket has grown up in the same settings but has taking a different route. His goal in life and dream is to take pictures and become a big photographer. He seems to always be in the wrong place at the wrong time though. Well in the 1980 there is still the continuing battle that is control and affecting the City of God. From my study in Latin American History, Brazil is the largest country in Latin America. It was one of the Portugal colonies sugar was one of the most important crops in the country. This country was declared independent from Portugal in 1822. "Brazil's problems -- poverty, crime, environmental recklessness -- can seem larger than life, too. Although it is one of the industrial powerhouses of South America, Brazil has trouble feeding its entire people. And deforestation of the Amazon basin proceeds at an ominous rate. But in fits and starts, the country is taking on some of its seemingly insoluble problems. Most noticeably, improvement is being made in the dangerous crime situation in Rio." This is the modern day report from a well know International travel agency about some of Brazil's problem's within the country. This movie in my opinion was rather accurate and ties in directly into the history of modern times in Brazil. It gives a real life visual to the actually life of some Brazilian natives. In contrast gives almost an unrealistic feeling about the whole city and everyday life of Brazil so with these to combine you get a distinct feeling of curiosity and wonder from the film. In my opinion if there would have been a brief introduction about the times in a narrative tone it would have help with the suspense of the movie? The movie was enjoyable to watch on the fact that the plot was good and the character where reliable and the quantity of scenes throughout the movie. Yes good for entertainment and great for education and addressee to the problems in Brazil. I rate this Movie 8 and half star on a (1-10) scale.

title: Nice , Great
author: farhan-shahab43
text: Adapting the novel by Paulo Lins, who grew up in the Cidade De Deus fa vela and based the story on actual events and characters, screenwriter Braulio Mantovani has condensed the mammoth 600-page tome into key chapters, titles of which appear on screen, and split the action into three specific periods: the late 1960s, the 1970s and the early '80s.

title: Summary: "To be a real hood, you need more than just a gun, You need ideas"
author: Andy01
text: City of God is a violent (and true) account of the way of life in the Brazilian slums: unemployment, poverty, drugs, police corruption, and gangs of hoodlums. It concentrates on the 2 different paths chosen by two central characters, and the different lifestyles they lead to.

title: Hard to watch for all the right reasons
author: mark000
text: This is a well-told and well-directed movie that I will go out on a limb and compare to some of Kubrick's films.  By the end, the message was so well-developed I had this vague impression that I had seen one of his better works.  The film is certainly harsh, as you would expect a film about gangs to be, but the harshness is integral to the story and cycle of violence which the movie is based on.  I highly recommend this to anyone who the topic interests.  For the Disney types, stay away.

title: this is the best film you will see this year
author: robcomber
text: without doubt the best film of the year and the year has only started. sure go see lord of the rings and sit for the 3 hours with your ass going asleep but enjoy it. NO! Go see City of God and prepare yourself for an edge of seat experience. it keeps you going the whole way through. non-stop enjoyment. i loved it.

title: A must see movie
author: z-tomov
text: One of the best movie i have seen so far. Very emotional and the storytelling is amazing. I wish to see more projects like this on the big screen and not always the same, boring Hollywood marketing. Also no big names attached, yet great acting. I can say anything more besides that the movie shows very realistic what it means to live in poverty and all the struggle involved in it.

title: Bloody Sensational, Painfully Fantastic
author: leonardorezende
text: City of God is finally  playing here in New York. I wanted to see this movie to see what's everybody is raving about. And I too had to keep going back to the theater because it was always sold out. Watching city of God felt like entering a haunted house.   I wanted to close my eyes at some scenes but it was so good -- and engaging -- that I didn't. It's bloody sensational and painfully fantastic.

author: cemoz
text: I think that Cidade de Deus is the new Godfather. Zé Pequeno is a blood-thirsty man this situation scares us because the things that we saw in that film happens in real world. I collect the crime films like Godfather, Goodfellas. Now Cidade de Deus is in my archive.

title: Intense!!!!
author: don_sol

You will feel your neck hairs curl up during the "foot or hand" scene...  This film is a realistic Quentin Tarantino style film on life in the projects in a third world country (now that is poor)...  This film should open the eyes of all that watch it...

title: A Brazilian masterpiece
author: hscabral
text: Even more than a hell of a great movie, City of God is also a "sign" to the brazilian producers. It's proved that we can produce good movies, with great direction of sound, music, photography, etc. Yes, it's violent, it's raw, but it's true. It's funny when you see others complaining about its content, since the Hollywood productions are SO much heavier... a good example? Gangs of New York. Do what I say, but don't do what I do.

title: Recommending "City of God" to friends
author: donna-mcdowell
text: I just thought the movie was very good. It held my attention from beginning to end. I also enjoy movies that make me care about the characters and this one made me care about Rocket, Benny, Carrot and even Lil' Fe (I could not help but feel his pain at Benny's farewell party). I will recommend this movie to several friends who are so-called "movie buffs". If you are not a fan of subtitled movies, this is not for you. I feel that if this movie was watched dubbed, it would take away some of the powerful drama that it has. I did not give it a ten because I am not a fan of slow-mo, speed up type of filming, but even that did not take away from the grittiness of the film.

title: An epic, involving gangster picture--superior to Goodfellas.

text: That's right. This is a film of amazing depth and realism. Dramatic but not melodramatic, action-packed but not manipulative. Brilliant performances, sharp screenplay, gritty yet beautiful cinematography. I can't praise this one enough.

title: A must see
author: scottbslade
text: City of God is an exciting, action packed, and breath taking film. Large amounts of colors and thrilling camera angels are used to tell this tropical story. The film takes place in the slums of Rio De Janeiro, where the people party and police are long away. Director Fernando Meirelles does an awesome job of bringing the crime filled, poverty-stricken, gangland to life. The movie opens up with a group of young men on a wild chase after a chicken. This is when Rocket, the narrator, enters the film. The film flashes back to show Rocket's and his peers' crime filled childhood. Then a young child named Lil' Dice, later known as Lil' Ze, is introduced into the story. Lil'Ze's story will be told along side Rocket's. Rocket becomes a photographer when he receives a stolen Camera as a gift. From that point on, he builds a love with the art of photography. Rocket gets a small gig working with the newspaper in his city. His camera roll gets in the hands of another photographer and they use the pictures Rocket took of a terrifying gang leader. When the head gang leader, who happens to be Lil'Ze, sees he made the newspaper he becomes excited from the publicity. Rocket on the other hand, thinks it the end of his life, but actually gets recognition from both sides. The newspaper starts to pay him to continue with more pictures of the gangs. Rocket ends up scoring big when he gets some pictures of a death of a young gang member that was killed by a cop. Rocket becomes a professional photographer and makes it out of the "City of God." City of God is more than just an action and crime filled story. It is the tale of a young man making it out of a city where no one ever makes out. The contrast of Lil' Ze and Rockets lives are powerful among each other. It shows the reality of the slums of Rio De Janeiro. You either gang bang or hope you make it out with a talent. With the whole film being in Portuguese it gives it an authentic feel. Despite having to read the subtitles the film is easy to follow and stay connected to. The different culture amazes me but also shows it has a lot of similarity to the US crime movies. This is a great film and I highly suggest it. To me it's a classic must see gangster crime film.

title: what impressed me the most
author: Dreaded_Fist_of_the_Northeast
text: is they had only a budget of $3.3 million.  even US independent films have an upwards of $10m or more in their purse.  this film showed alot of heart, from the wicked cuts to the overhead angles, it put you right in the thick of things.  it was gritty, it was intriguing, it was subtle yet straight to the point.  very powerful piece of filmmaking, and about the violence, I believe that the filmmakers showed it quite well.  they used their flashbacks really well, and I was overly impressed with the whole scheme of the movie.

title: What a Masterpiece!

title: aok
author: gabjenei
text: Set in Brazil in the 1970s, the film tells the story of Rocket (Alexandre Rorigues in an excellent, understated performance), a teenage boy living in an extremely violent area of Rio De Janeiro called The City of God. Like most boys his age, all Rocket wants is to get laid, smoke a little blow and chill with his friends. However, the violence around him not only complicates this it throws him smack dab in the middle of it. When he loses his low paying job, he watches with envy the carefree life of the drug lords Lil Zee and Benny (Leandro Firmino and Phellipe Haagensen respectively) who run the ghetto. They flash money and ride brand new motor scooters through the streets of the hood. When he loses his girl to the more enigmatic gangster Benny, Rocket declares in frustration, "It was like a message from God: Honesty doesn't pay, sucker." Seeing delinquency as the only way to prosper, Rocket decides to pursue criminal ventures of his own. Fortunately, Rocket and his equally square buddy, prove to be the most inept of criminals. They don't even have the heart to rob a lost drunk who has unwittingly gotten lost in the slums. Rocket soon resigns himself to the fact he's no criminal. He's one of the nobodies. One of the thousands whose fate is in the hands of a few crazy fools with guns. Luckily for Rocket, fate was waiting around the corner with a better hand for him to play.

title: Go watch how sin prevails in "City of God"
author: ocapra_4
text: If you are looking for a different movie than what you are used to, and you are bored of Hollywood movies, "City of God" is the movie you should watch. It is a Brazilian movie released in 2002, directed by Fernando Meirelles. If you enjoy crime and drama films, the movie will capture you easily since the very beginning. "City of God" portrays Brazilian life in the slums where drugs and violence are always present. We might never have had imagined the violence and crime behind one joint of marijuana, but this movie exposes us to the rough path of getting involved with drugs and gangs.

title: Review City of God
author: alex_finolr
text: The only godly thing the city has, is its name.

title: A Short Review of the movie " City Of God"
author: mariapiaor
text: "City of God" will change your perspective.

title: City of God view from a film studies student **SPOILERS**
author: calvin1996
text: The City of God weaves about five different stories together into an on screen masterpiece. One would think that with that many separate plots the overall story would be lost or hard to understand but that is not the case with this film. The directors use parallel editing and flash backs to help tell the story of each individual character and how they fit into the bigger plot. This could be confusing but the directors use a narrator to help keep the stories straight. Even though this is a film with different stories no character is left undeveloped. Each story is told in the same environment of the other stories, with characters from different stories interacting with each other. This allows the audience to make a strong connection with each character, even if it's not their story. The film is also shot using a lot of close ups, this helps the audience with their connection as it puts them in the personal space of each character. The stories told however are not light stories, all involve the use of drugs, sex, and gang violence, with children taking part in all activates. The movie manages to desensitize the audience to these things though, as it wants to give a feel of what the characters have to live with every day. During some of the darker scenes the lighting is actually fairly bright and the music is upbeat, this assists with the desensitization. To help the audience feel more involved and apart of the story the film is shot with mainly a hand held camera, this physically puts them in the stories, and not as if just viewing it. Overall I would highly recommend this film to anyone, it keeps your interest the whole time, gives you a view into a life that is completely different then here, and by the end of the film you will realize how the cycle continues.

title: Excellent!!
author: spdss-spdss
text: It is a film that don't have the history of hero of 1000 faces. It explain the basic corruption on Brazil. I's a story of Tadim (Zé pequeno), a boy who grew up in the "favela" and who was forced to enter the world of crime early on. He killed several people, robbed, corrupted, etc. A brutal and impressive film that I highly recommend Great, great great...

title: In the heart of sunny Rio de Janeiro lies a dark world of poverty, violence, and the crumbled lives of young children.
author: donatasruzys
text: "If you raise a snake, expect to get bitten." Unfortunately, those who raised Lil Dice never received his own words of wisdom. The 2002 film City of God, directed by Fernando Meirelles and Katia Lund, is anything but what the title might suggest. The viewer is taken on an unforgettable childhood journey that is narrated by Rocket, a young boy who grew up in Ciudad De Deus (City of God), one of the deadliest slums in all of Rio de Janeiro. From the very beginning, City of God is the type of film that captivates an audience with its unique visual style, letting the viewers know they are in for a true cinematic treat. In 2004 the film was nominated for four Academy awards, including Best Cinematography and Best Director. In spite of the severe hardship and the gut-wrenching violence, the cinematographic effects of the film leave the viewer glued to the screen, immersed with intrigue, and begging to hear more about the story of each character, who, at one point or another, fell prey to the evil world around them. The visual appeal of the film cannot be overemphasized. All aspects of editing, from lighting and camera angles, to moving camera shots and mechanical distortions of movement, are pieced together in the most brilliant and fascinating forms. Visual effects are not the sole appeal of the film, as the film takes the viewer on a nose dive into the life stories of several characters, allowing the viewer to understand the characters on a personal level and, in some cases, even form strong emotional attachments. In fact, many of the characters in the movie were recruited from the slums of Rio, including Alexandre Rodriques, who plays Rocket and had grown up in the actual City of God itself. In the City of God, the "hoods", or gangsters, are the role models for little kids playing in the streets. They are the ones the little kids look up to and grow up wishing to be. However, these hoods are nothing but kids themselves, young boys, who are given a gun at a young age and made to believe that poverty can be escaped through the short lived treasures of crime. As much as one would love to see Goose, Benny, or any of the other hoods put down their guns, it is important to remember that "a hood doesn't stop, a hood takes a break."

title: A help to open your eyes to reality...
author: vera_sabino
text: I do not love this movie because of the story that represents...and why? it's really frustrating to know in the present days that such violence, misery, exists in a way that makes you think, takes your sleep away, because this reality really exists, and I do not praise the misery but the fact that the filmmaker shows it in a way that you feel involved in the movie, the sadness, and what the people can do to one another just to survive. So I loved this movie because showed a reality that the most part of the people prefer to shut their eyes, than see it...so when you see this movie don't think you will see a bunch of people killing one each other, but a corruption and the killing of the mind and the respect of the human being living in such a condition, that no one, children, men, women should live...so when you see this movie, just think about it...

title: A movie that DEMANDS your attention
author: ryanmlange-69119
text: This is a film that I have seen before but recently re-watched it again and really wasn't sure how the film would impact me the second time around, the film is quite shocking and hard to stomach at times the first time around so the second time the concern was there that it would lose a lot of its emotional impact. But only a few minutes into watching this film through its incredibly frantic editing, its almost hypnotizing cinematography and some of the most realistic performances i have ever seen, it was clear to me that this film would never ever quite lose the impact it so easily has on the viewer.

title: "The displacement of impoverished black youth in the city of God and the changes incurred on a sociological level"
author: wafiqag
text: City of God is based on real events and figures; adapted from a largely biographical novel by Paulo Lins, the film uses mainly amateur actors, location shooting, and hand-held camera work to convey a sense of realism. Meirelles has discussed the film as a criticism not only of Brazilian society, but global economic forces, saying that "no country is as unfair as the world itself". And I want to discuss "The displacement of impoverished black youth in the city of God and the changes incurred on a sociological level"
