A REAL vision and possibility of a life inshanty towns of Rio of Janeiro, by a boy's point of view. in the first scene the boy is situated in a situation between two "gangs" of a same Favela*, split in two possibility of two endings not happy.

title: An authentic, gritty and gripping film, encapsulating the real life problems faced with living in the slums
author: rick_maskell92
text: City of God is based on the novel by Paulo Lins, which follows Rocket and his friends growing up in one of Brazil's most notorious slums. A hippie at heart, Rocket (played by Alexandre Rodrigues) made it his destiny to stay on the right side of the law and become a photographer, which would prove tough in a place where crime seemed the only option.

title: "In the hand, or the foot?"
author: Bwheels
text: "In the hand, or the foot", the chilling choice offered up to the smallest of children by Li'l Ze, the toughest hood ever to rule over the City of God. As the children cry and the gangsters laugh we are shown a world so far removed from our own that we find it difficult to even comprehend the lives that face these characters. This is the moment when we realise that these characters are not figments of some writers imagination, but they are representing the conditions that hundreds of thousands of people face each day of their lives. It is this quality that contributes to the powerful message delivered by Meirelles' "City of God".

title: WOW - Great Movie
author: montanagirl
text: This movie is riveting. It is impossible to turn your head away from the screen for a moment. What an incredible story. An honest and gut-wrenching look at the drug underground in Rio de Janero in the 1960s and 1970s.

title: What an amazing display of acting and directing talent
author: frankiec996
text: Out of all of the movies that I have seen (yes i have seen a lot), this is one of my favorites. The good acting and the good camera shots and genius directing make this movie a top 50 movie.

title: This is reason there are movies
author: BryceVR
text: When we get past the entertainment there is a hook in the soul that a true film portrays. It is a movie. It is a docudrama It is a long painful look at ourselves. The pleasure and gratification against the squalor and despair of the environment. The Juxtaposition of the protagonists and their inevitable showdown gives us extraordinary drama within the reality of the Sao Paulo ghetto. There are very few movies, books or plays than can hope to get here, Schindlers list, Shawshank redemption and Paths of Glory are a few that spring to mind as naked comments on the primal nature of man. This movie moves the primal nature into your face and keeps it there, unrelentingly. A must see movie in any definition.

title: Great show of the 60s-70s underground of Rio
author: newsofthegalaxy
text: This is a very good movie and a great editing, music, acting, and direction. Just because you need to read the subtiles does not mean that you need to be a film snob to see and enjoy it. It will make you think and you can not stop watching it.

title: not as good as many say
author: snowgoddessq
text: I am always surprised at how much extreme violence in a movie can take the place of good dialogue and character development.  Granted, I did just read the subtitles, so maybe the original text was better.  But aside from that, I thought that City of God was a horrible waste of my time.  It is good that movies like that are made, but I do not think they should be seen as the only type of movie to see and thus the best.  I saw no real point to the story other than how terrible the life on the streets in Brazil is and how wonderful it was that the narrator survived it.  Some of the scenes made me sick and if that's what it takes to be a good film these days, then I'd rather watch the usual rubbish that comes out these days.

title: Rio de Janeiro in a new light
author: CSauc
text: ***SPOILER ALERT***

title: Sarah Simar—City of God
author: alicat-86171
text: Guns, gangs, crime, drugs, power, wealth, survival—these are the most obvious themes in the City of God. There is no way out, no safe place to hide in the City of God. If you are not in a gang, you are forced into one at a very young age. One of the main characters and narrator of the story, Rocket, dreams of being a photographer and getting out of this violent world. The other one, Ze Pequeno, wants to rule the city from a young age with his partner Benny and accomplishes just that through a series of malicious acts. These two characters are so radically different but their paths cross more than once throughout the movie. These moments reiterate the theme that there is no way out, even for Rocket, who wants nothing to do with any gang.

title: City of God
author: johnmbradley
text: The City of God takes you to a place about as far from the idea of heaven that we are given as the years have gone on. In this film we are able to see how our narrator Rocket and a boy the same age as him named Lil Ze do with the lives they have been given in lawless city. This film gives a great insight into the dangers of living in this dangerous neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro and how just where you live and are brought up can affect your life in so many ways. It also shows to us how people can judge you by where you live and made snap decisions about you when they learn where you are from. Time and time again in this film we are shown how characters can are expected to be part of a gang because of where they live and how they cannot keep certain jibs because the owners learn where they are from. We are also shown the different possibilities someone faces when you grow up in a bad neighborhood. Do you stay and rule the neighborhood, try to get out and die, get out then get brought back, or be that lucky few who gets out and has a future. Overall I felt like this was an outstanding film and gave a great look at the struggles of growing up in a bad neighborhood and feel anyone should watch it to give themselves something to reflect on that may never occurred to them before.

title: A timely piece on gun violence and children, but still missing some pieces.
author: geraldplangosch
text: Violence on children is something that has been strayed away from in film due to fear of being taboo. In City of God, the true story of gang wars that take place in a small city in Rio during the 1960s and 1970s, violence against (and typically stemming from) children is anything but taboo, and so it is that the children define the film. Their interactions both business-like and genuine, and with little remorse from any of the involved.

title: Amazing film
author: kleto
text: The City of God directed by Fernando Mierrelles is an intense spectacle of the brutal life inside Brazils notorious favelas. Two boys with completely different ways of life put on a show from theft, murder, to drugs to the complete opposite side of the spectrum which is photography. The film was a beautiful peace of art, utilizing everything from lighting changes, camera angles, and close-ups to see and really feel the intensity of a scene. These all also help portray the poverty and hardships that those in the favelas must face. Blood, dirt, and garbage couldn't seem to leave the streets of Rio De Janeiro. Acting in the film was good but could have been better. At times, the actors almost seemed uncomfortable in certain parts of the movie like in death scenes. The movie was a very intense movie that kept me very interested from the very start to the end. The way the director told the story was the best part, in my opinion. The director would tell a single characters story one at a time and did it in chronological order until the director got to the end of the story, which is also the beginning of the film. Despite the acting not being the greatest, the film was actually magnificent and I would highly recommend this movie to everyone being that it is base off a true story and gives the viewer a better perspective on life and their position.

title: Movie Review
author: kywi-45612
text: WARNING: SPOLER ALERT!

title: City of God is a film that takes place in the favelas of Brazil. It is a crime drama that revolves around guns, love, sex and drugs.
author: samuelrgarcia
text: Brazil, the beautiful country located South America has many documentaries displaying its beauty. The City of God has an establishing shot where we see the chaos that is in the favelas of Brazil. The sound editing of the film was superb. There are moments in the film where you completely do not notice the sound editing, but there are scenes where you look back on and realize how genius the sound editing was. Good sound editing is forgotten about because it was either not terrible but not great. Great sound editing is noticed. City of God plays with mundane sounds and makes us feel them. Gun shots are expected in a gangster movie, but City of God creates a symphony with the gun shots. Some shots are louder than others, some gun shots also resonate longer. There is also a melodic tempo in which the gangs shoot their guns. The mise-en-scene in the film is also simple, but powerful. We look into the homes of many of the characters. Most of the characters live in poverty, we see this reflected in their homes. Although the characters do not have much, we can tell a story alone based on the items they wear and the objects that that they have. City of God is a great film that recommend everyone should watch. The sound editing plays along with the great dialog and the mise-en-scene is simple, but effective. City of God opens your eyes to the beauty and travesty of living in some parts of Brazil

title: What a Film
author: jcheese-86933
text: The characters in this movie were what made this piece so special. It almost felt like we had to choose what side we were fighting with, Knockout Ned or the infamous Li'l Ze. The movie begins by explaining the "City of God" a small scummy place in the middle of Rio DE Janeiro, Brazil. Drug dealers run the streets and kids kill other kids just for fun. Li'l Ze begins his life by joining the older kids with petty crimes but escalates to mass murder within a few minutes. He grows up to be one of the most feared and ruthless drug dealers in the "City of God." Knockout Ned, with the help of Carrot, led the other drug gang in the city. Li'l Ze kills Ned's family and destroys his family home. This is when the war begins. The film pushes us to join Ned's force because he wants justice, all he wants is revenge for his families' death. We follow every move up until his death. This is the scene that got me the most. We see the most caring person, even in the middle of battle field, try to help a wounded child. The moment Knockout Ned turns around the child shoots him in the back. This scenes amazing because it showed me everyone was in this war for some personal reason. The reason the kid was in the war, to get revenge for his father's death. Who killed his father you ask? Knock Out Ned. Nobody cared about the cause of the war, but the war gave them a cause to fight and kill those who did them wrong.

title: City of God ***SPOILER ALERT***
author: poulettegarcia
text: ****SPOILER ALERT****

title: City of God
author: christopherjkoelle
text: City of God (2002) directed by Fernando Meirelles and Katia Lund paints an entirely different picture of life in Rio than the welcoming Cristo Redentor may exude. The film explores the dangerous, yet sadly mundane life that the youth live in the slum that the poor live in called the City of God. Rocket, a young photographer trying to separate himself from the violence, narrates the story and captures the daily life of the city through his lens.

title: City of God Spoilers!!!!
author: tartedav
text: With the name city of god, you would expect a more upbeat movie that is based around religion. Instead the movie depicts the horrors of organized crime in the suburb of Rio de Janeiro in the 1970s. As the movie continues you to begin to see a pattern occur for many of the people that live in this area. As characters are raised in these in violet areas they eventually become violent themselves. It becomes a viscous cycle of a constant struggle of power for each generation since they see the power and money that could be obtained if they go into organized crime. This is seen in the ending where the character "Lil Zé is murdered by his own gang members since he lost some of his power and showed the children who murdered him how to obtain power in organized crime. This ending particularly shows that the city is never going to fix itself. It will have another generation that will become more violent and strive for power like the beginnings of Lil Zé career. This gives the characters in the city of god to run away from the city or to commit crimes.

title: Great performance
author: benhalljr
text: Stand out performances,brilliant script, great direction, the story is very good, and I could not stop watching..

title: Many consider a movie outstanding just because it shows tragic poverty and violence
author: lecirquestudio
text: Many consider a movie outstanding just because it shows tragic poverty and violence. Subconsciously, people feel "politically correct" for liking it. Praise becomes a form of self- elevation, whilst the mere, unnecessary styling offends the topic's intrinsic seriousness. The ideological showcase overcomes an honest presentation. Mixing tragic elements to create a shocking, poignant movie is easy. But somehow the whole thing becomes a farce too pretentious to be positively assessed. An unpunished, 10 year old killer runs around, kills everyone and then bursts into evil laughs. The horrifying situation exists in reality. But a film approach ought to be different. This film has been sold as a kind of triumph of the human spirit, yet it's no more than a typical mobster movie sited at Jacarepaguá. Scene after scene, someone is killed and the deaths have the same depth or significance of a video game. The protagonist does nothing to improve himself. He is a social victim, period. He features the moral character of a robot. And banditry, to the Brazilians' 'delight,' recruits untouchable children as hoods. A Guy Ritchie-like gang plot has its moments of shock: non stop bloodbaths & revolting human filth. For those fond of Grand Guignol, this is a perfect movie. Horrible and cheap in all aspects, including pain and suffering. Simply pathetic, filmed as an elegant commercial edited with rather annoying camera movements. City of God was just another product from the Third World that dazzled the radical chic community of the First World.

title: City of Epic film!
author: narshsmith
text: Great film from begin to end! From Police chases , relatable characters and beautiful back drop of Brazil, presents a thrilling story told in the ghetto.

title: Actually very nice movie
author: martyboyum
text: Oh .oh . it,s really good movie forever . watch too many time .

title: original Gangster film, but gets boring.
author: bporter-porter3
text: The film begins in the 60's and when you're watching this part, you have high hopes for the rest of the film, as it shows a lot of promise, however don't get your hopes up. Little Ze's killing spree's in the 70's and 80's become over the top, and the amount of deaths are ridiculous. However the cliffhanger ending where the kids talk about their own killing spree , leaves a nice, but horrific cliff hanger ending. It is very different to most gangster films as it contains some type of background story as it's based on a true story. The story of Rocket is also very endearing, as throughout the film you find yourself willing him to do well in his photography, so this for me makes up for the over the top violence ,so brings the film up from a 5, to a 6 out of10.One to watch if you're into international cinema or/and violent films.

title: Highly Rated, and for Good Reason
author: agnesmolek
text: POSSIBLE SPOILER ALERT

title: Styalized brilliance in a thrilling and gripping journey. Ditch the Hollywood formula. YOU WILL NOT LEAVE YOUR SEAT
author: zachwilliams
text: I am an avid user of IMDb. When I see a good film I will give it a good vote. When I see an excellent film I may just give it a ten. "City of God" is unlike anything I have ever seen. This film takes the boundaries of excellence and destroys them--it is the only film that has inspired me to compose a comment. Take brilliant directing, a captivating story and excellent cinematography, and you will get "City of God".

title: The City of God: Eye Opener
author: daynakalvaro
text: SPOILER ALERT!

title: A Thrilling Ride (Contains Possible Spoilers)
author: ryanward-78234
text:
City of God is unlike many foreign movies you will see. From start to finish, this movie will keep you on the edge of your seat. The movie starts off with a fun game of soccer between young kids, with the main character introducing himself to the audience. Very shortly after, you learn the stories and the lives of those close to him and the violence that entangles each and every person living in their small town. While the film jumps from character to character, the movie revolves around Rocket, who is trying to find his place growing up in the slums.
Each important character is introduced by either slow motion or a freeze frame of them on screen and then an introduction by Rocket to the audience explaining who they are and then followed up by their story and how they are relevant to Rocket. This use of editing, while it may seem outdated and tacky, is really helpful for the audience to get an idea of who each person is in this story and to give a good amount of information about each character. This simple editing is really key to the story because it symbolizes Rockets future career and aspirations as a future photographer. The still frames of the characters with Rocket explaining who they are is just like if someone were to hold up a picture of that person and Rocket would explain their purpose to him.
This movie is a must see for anyone that is in need of seeing a fantastic foreign film. While there is heavy violence, it helps capture the life these characters had and how their life changes so much throughout the film. It will keep you watching and wanting to know more from start to finish.

title: Fantastic - *Potential Spoilers*
author: erinlong-78407
text: This film opens in a unique fashion, by cutting from different actions that are occurring around the city. While the opening to the film seems somewhat overwhelming at first, we learn that it is truly vital to throughout the film. The opening is thrilling and definitely sets the tone for the remainder of the film. We are introduced to our main character and narrator, Rocket, very early on in the opening. Rocket comes off as a quite relatable character, as it easily seen that he does not quite fit in with what is going on around him, in both his friend groups and within the city he lives.

title: Environment Effects way of life
author: annelapunkal
text: City of God was an interesting film that showed how the root of violence can stem from one's environment. The choices that were made by each individual in the movie either led to their death, downfall, or success. Lil Dice, on the other hand, was the exception; on the statistical side of the spectrum. He was a part of a robbery in the beginning of the movie and from that moment he chooses his path. He killed innocent people just for the fun of it, inferring that from the smile and laughter he got from the crime. There were many low angle shots of Lil Dice shooting at the ground, aiming at someone. With each shot, he got older. The angle of the shot and the gun in his hand made him appear powerful in the audience's eyes. As time passed, he became more powerful. The last shot from that scene also showed Benny with him, shooting at the sky while Lil dice was shooting at someone.This last shot gave foreshadowed hope for Benny. Although they shared an environment, Benny fell in love and was trying to change his life. He attempts to leave the life of crime. The scene at the dance was ominous. From the zoom in on the kid with the gun, the loud music, the lighting, and the pan shot of Lil Dice moving towards Rocket suggest that this scene was going to be important. If I had to take something away from this film, it would be that life is all about choices and sometimes it is out of your control. The environment that you are brought up in effects your life tremendously. The people around you influence your decisions and it can teach or even kill you in the end.

title: City of God: Nature vs. Nurture
author: megob-23058
text: The term City of God refers to the unity of the Holy Roman Empire and the Roman Catholic Church. In the case of the 2002 film City of God, however, it tells the story of a neighborhood divided. The narrative of the film is unique because while it is told from the perspective of Rocket it is still able to tell the stories of several other residents of the City of God. This element is crucial as the movie would not have worked if you did not understand each of these characters and who they have become as a result of their environment.

title: That's not really the truth
author: tetrical
text: For sure it is a great movie but a very factional movie! Living in Brazil isn't exactly like that... It is a country almost large as US, and it has deep differences between one state and another.

title: Must See! Cinematic work of art with a great story
author: mikeprzzl
text: The City of God goes above and beyond when it comes to informing the world as to what really goes on in the slums; in this particular case, in Brazil. After viewing the film, I quickly learned that people got dragged into a particular lifestyle based on who they surrounded themselves with. People either chose to get educated and get a job, or they became gangsters and robbed. The main character, "Rocket", happens to fall somewhere in between. The directors use a unique story-telling method and a variety of special effects to put together this cinematic work of art. Right off the bat, we are given a flash-forward to one of the ending scenes following a hand-held camera running after a chicken. This instantly sets the tone and lets the audience know that they are in for an action packed movie that will keep you on the edge of your seat. As a part of this flash forward, the directors use "Matrix-Like" bullet time to give us a unique perspective as to what kind of situation Rocket is in. Furthermore, the film uses a variety of montages to compress as much info as possible, whether we are learning about a drug operation or the development of a certain character; the use of these montages is an extremely effective method of catching the audience up with what is going on. To initiate and conclude a character's personal narrative, the narrator would directly mention that we were observing someone new. These personal narratives were often concluded with a murder of some sort working in sync with fade outs (almost always indicating changes in plot without direct narration). Overall, I was very impressed with the film's story and cinematic elements. The suspense consistently had me wondering what will happen next and when looking at the production as a whole, it was hard to believe the film was over 15 years old. I would highly recommend it to anyone of age.

title: Real on a Historical Level
author: lazers-91939
text: The City of God may be an ironic title for the movie. The film is set in a slum of Rio and focuses on the story of a group of kids who grew up to be adults still living the slum. The set of the film truly encompasses the looks and appearances of how slum and the people in the slum would appear in real life, which helps add to the fact that the film is based on a true story. This also adds to the realness of the film itself. The development of each character really helps create the plot and each character builds off of each other, which makes the film enthralling. Each character keeps the audience on the edge of their seats wondering what will happen next; and the film is set for all audiences. The casting of each actor was very methodical, as all of the actors seemed to fit directly into their roles and assume the personalities and feelings of each person's lives. However, I definitely believe they may have type casted the actor who played Angelica because she appeared to have very basic skills in acting. Besides her, the rest of the actors allow you to connect directly with their characters and understand them as human beings. The film creators even play the historical interviews after the credits to supplement the information given throughout the movie. The director even lined up one the interviews of a person with their character in the movie almost exactly, which also contributed to the realness of the movie.

title: An Underrated Gem
author: richardmachaj
text:
City of God Review
This movie had me on the edge of my seat even after I learned that it was in a foreign language. The City of God puts you right in the action of all the gang violence and the director does an incredible job with the editing and lighting such as in the scene where Benny is killed. Cidade de Deus disorients the audience in this scene just like how the characters were with many close up shots and blinding lights. The last thing that I expected was for Benny to get killed because he was one of the only major characters that wanted to get away from all the violence. To add to his unexpected death, his killer was a man that loved Benny, and this death scene speaks to the chaotic lifestyle in the Brazilian favelas that keep you guessing.

title: City of God or City of Evil?
author: roberttalarico
text:
The City of a God is a very ironic name for this movie as well as the city that the film takes place in. When people think of God they picture happiness and well being. In this film however, the City of God is full of thieves and murderers. This movie tells the story of how a group of children grow up with very little parental guidance and gives you a chance to see some of their challenges when they are younger as well as when they are older. The down goes down hill through out the movie and you get the chance to see a boy and his dream to become a photographer come in to play as he uses the power of his photographs to create his own affect on the situation.
Personally, I really enjoyed the movie. It was full of action and kept you on your toes multiple times in anticipation for what was to come. What really drew me to this film was that circumstances similar to these have happened around the world through history and for someone looking from the outside in, it really gives you a sense of how lucky you really are.
As far as the quality of the film goes, it was many action shots showing the perspective of many different characters. The lighting also brought a lot of character to the movie as well, because a lot of the dirty work was done at night time behind the safely of darkness. I believe the makers of this film did a very good job at depicting many of the details of this movie. From the movement of drugs and movie, to the handling of guns and the brittleness of life, they directors captured all of it very well to the point that you could feel what the characters were feeling
 Overall I felt that this was a very well directed movie with a lot of very well captured moments. I would definitely recommend this movie to someone who interested in historical and action filled movies.

title: Nonstop action in City of God - (SPOILERS)
author: dominiqueporus
text: Based on the notorious slums of Rio de Janeiro, City of God is an ironic film (due to the title and narrative) depicting the many struggles of violence that the kids have to live through day in and day out. The film goes through a full circle, scenes being shown back and forth between the past and future years. The persistent use of flashbacks certainly catch the viewers' attention in an extremely dynamic way. The main character, Rocket, narrates as himself experiencing the constant violence and vulgarity that is represented so meticulously. Rocket and his friends do not have a typical upbringing as most children - instead, they are consistently surrounded by vicious criminals who take pleasure in raping and murdering their victims. Lil' Dice and other hoodlums represent how the society views men in the film. Power is essential to these appalling individuals, and it is clear that they will do whatever they need to obtain the highest amount of control over the weaklings in the city. Despite the struggles of his upbringing in the City Of God, Rocket wants to be successful and make something out of his substandard life. His passion for photography is very well demonstrated throughout the film. The characterization of not only Rocket and his peers, but the criminals in the film as well, undoubtedly keeps the viewers on their toes constantly. The action is so relentless that it can be difficult to keep one's eyes away from the screen for even a moment. Being based in the 1960's, it is only fair to say that the editing of City Of God is subpar, however this is what makes the film so very compelling and it would not be as engaging if it was presented in a different way.

title: An Enthralling Narrative of Beautiful Cinematography and Sharp Social Commentary
author: zakiyacowan
text:
Fernando Meirelles' and Katia Lund's 2002 film, City of God, is a vortex that swallows the audience into its cyclic narrative that emphasizes the dangers of toxic masculinity and consequences of the notion "being a man." As observed in the film, a twisted perspective of manhood can be a bullet that passes through one generation to the next, destined to extinguish them all. 
 Throughout City of God, there is a theme of possession and an obsession with power, even at the expense of others. Young boys in the film admire their elders and develop a seething hunger to be "hood" and join this world of deceit, danger, and money; resulting in the tragic downfall of some young men as they endure this conquest to manhood and success. Along the way, women are slain, stripped of their bodily agency, and objectified, left at the disposal of men. Simultaneously, drugs and drug spots are overtaken in an endless battle to be "top dog." City of God manifests itself into a condemnation of conditioning young men to think that in order to "be a man," they have to achieve that title by all means necessary. City of God is a violent, brutal attestation to the detrimental aftermath that ensues when boys live in society where drugs, money, and power equate to the value of one's self-image. 
 Meirielles' film is a stunning execution of a labyrinth-like storyline in which the audience delves into the lives of multiple characters. Then, through cinematic moves such as foreshadowing and flashbacks, seamlessly intertwines these plots that become a metaphorical domino effect. As the film progresses, and gradually strips down the plot, we observe how the actions of one character causes a steady disruption in the lives of everyone else. From the jarring, handheld camera scenes, to the drastic shifts in color gradients from deep, saturated blues, to honeyed yellows, the audience experiences the chaotic and disruptive life of the film's gang members. Similarly, to the characters in the story, the audience is overtaken by this whirlpool narrative, trapped in "the slum that had been a purgatory." But, "now it's hell."

title: Brutal but Important Story
author: madelinemschaal
text:
City of God is a heartbreaking yet eye-opening look at how children grow up quickly or, unfortunately, not at all in the slums of Brazil. At many points during the film it is comparable to seeing the violent coverage on television news programs about happens daily in the city of Chicago. 
I found it hard to watch this film at many points because of the sheer brutality because it involved younger children. I feel that as a nation we are often desensitized to violence due to various video games, television shows, movies, and real life. However, it is a different story when the violence revolves around younger children. 
An important aspect of the story that I found moving was the fact that this film is based off of true events. The main character, Alexandre Rodrigues, actually lived in the location where the film takes place. 
One issue I have with the film is the fact that I found it difficult to focus on the movie and the characters while also needing to pay close attention to the subtitles. This film requires your full attention at all times. While it is obvious that this is a minor problem, it is still important to take into account before watching. 
One aspect of the film that I enjoyed was the sequence of scenes where we learned how the small apartment had been used by the different gang leaders and how it had changed hands over time. 
The audience is encouraged to root for Rocket as he tries to escape his dangerous slum. City of God is an important and raw re-telling of Rocket's experiences growing up and his journey to escape the seemingly unavoidable fate of those of live among him.

title: Beautifully made
author: oparamo-99783
text: The film City Of God is a heart string pulling film full of hate, violence, love and sadness. This film touches upon struggles that low income cities encounter in other countries. It heavily displays the affects of crime and drug trafficking to those involved and bystanders. Such struggles can push any child or adult into a life that they later recognize they do not want or into a life where they end up dying. The film introduced us to certain characters and informs the audience that it is based on true events, in a way to form a connection, with that connection the audience felt hurt and/or mad when the characters did.

title: Why?
author: dudestevie
text: Powerful. Exciting. A fantastic storyline. Impressive dialogue.

title: A raw reality of the brazilian suburbs
author: reano
text: Everybody should see this movie. It shows the "favela" reality in a way never explored before. And also give us a feeling of guilt, a throat-closing feeling every time you see a 6-year-old child handing a gun.

title: Great! Better them Traffic
author: JohnConstantine
text: Great movie! Perfect picture of life in slums ruled buy drug dealers. This movie was made with real people from this neighborhood including the main characters. It's very violent but also very truthful. Action, violence and reality as expected a little humor sometimes. It's great! Better them Traffic.

title: Raw. Moving. Real.
author: VIPER22
text: I can't say that I loved the movie, but I know when I've seen a very good and powerful movie.

title: God and His City
author: guto_ribeiro
text: Who supports the Brazilian traffic? Who supports 'Zé Galinha'? As the journalist in this movie, people who adore to talk bad about the police and the thieves. Hypocrites that adore to light a joint to relax and only think about himself. I know that this side does not only exist, that the traffic has much more webs around it, and we cannot cannot forget how that is very important.

title: gangster
author: kbueschenfeld
text: this movie is not only a normal cinema movie in my opinion. it is the passion of cinema.the movies has the lowest budget you can have ,and the actors are laien from the city of god. but they aren't perfect in there playing like tom hanks in road to perdition or Edward Norton in American history x .but cause of this normal negative aspect the film is already great ,then the characters show the life in the slums between drugs ,violence and maltreatment . sometimes the film is wonderful in his action and dialogs ,but then a moment later it is like punch when a character dies. i think cicade de deus is a brilliant movie and the best ever made in this time.

title: AMAZING!!
author: agerbergju
text: This movie is absolutely amazing. A classic everyone has to watch.

title: Absolutely Brilliant
author: kingjamz
text: Cidade de Deus was amazing. I usually don't enjoy reading subtitles all the way through a film, but after the first 2 minutes, i was so drawn in i forgot they were there. The actors are brilliant considering they are all relative unknowns, well in Britain and the US anyway. The film takes a look at the underworld of brazil's largest city, Rio De Janero and what is discovered will shock as much as it will entertain you. A city that is rife with crime, from seasoned gangsters to 10 year old boys, everyone is killing, stealing and dealing their way through life in order to survive in the city of god. If you haven't seen this film, watch it as soon as.

title: The jaggedness of horror with real-life emotions
author: amgeographer
text: As a fellow film enthusiast, city of god has been a mind boggling experience for me that i ever I've had with Brazilian cinemas. Sadness, anxiety and tragedy are recognized, but not the kind of usual outrage that we see in true-to-life American films about con crimes.

title: Piece of history
author: ee95104
text: Not only an excelent film, this film is a wonderful documentary of the last 30 years of brasilian urban life. More specific of the poor neighbourhoods, known as "favela". "Cidade de Deus" is such a "favela", created by the government to create housing without satisfying other basic needs. More than a documentary, this film is action packed. Gangsters, drug dealers, corrupt policeman, well, what more could you want? There are car chases, gunfight, pretty much of everything. Just to topple that, there is a multitude of sub plots, that bring us back and forth in time, and immerse the viewers in the history of this "favela". One feels part of it, and acquainted to all the characters, as they develop through the film. Amazingly enough, or maybe not, it is based on true stories... That can explain the extreme realistic feel we get throughout the film, one can hardly imagine we are looking at actors...

title: Capturing
author: inspocean-82059
text: Outstanding story telling. A tale of growing up a youngster. At the heart of brutality fueled by poverty. The concept of growing up too fast gets a new perspective here. The audience is thrown from the start into the flames of an escalating violence. A no mans land with absent fathers and mother too busy too care. You probably have already heard about street children, here you will live their life. Hardly any one been able to recapture the pain of lost childhood so intensely. You do not get a second chance, so your first mistake could be your lost one. Loyalty does not pay the usual way. A piece truly able to keep you on the chair through the whole movie.

title: My first film from Brazil.
author: jackshow-34413
text: Brazilians know how to make a good movie or is just this one? I really really liked it and everything looked so real. I later read that everything is "real" - they shot it there in the favelas. Crazy.

title: Brazilian Filmmaking at its Finest
author: thomaschaidez
text: The name City of God is ironic, because there seems to be no god present here. Fernando Meirelles does a great job giving an extremely convincing depiction of how cut throat and desperate life can be in the poverty stricken favela, and that is down to filming location, and the authentic performances giving by the actors, many of whom were not professional and actually lived in City of God, if not nearby favelas.

title: An experience you will not forget, nor regret.
author: lorenzojferro
text: If you have a pacemaker, make sure to turn it up a beat and prepare yourself for The City of God. This movie chucks a lot at you in the opening sequences where your eyes are bolting around like a chicken without its head. This movie does not expect you to swallow everything about it and instead forces you to take it as a whole-body experience.

title: City of God
author: jessehoffmeyer
text:
People enjoy a coming-of-age story. Seeing someone struggle through hardship and come out stronger and more prepared in the end. But in the City of God, coming-of-age starts with you holding your first gun, and ends with you on the streets; cold and stiff. People enjoy a war story. Falling in love with characters fighting through hell to come back to the safety of home and reunite with loved ones. But in the City of God, there is no safety to return to, and no family left to protect.
City of God seamlessly blends a coming-of-age tale in the midst of violent gang warfare in the slums, called favelas, of Rio de Janeiro. At parts, the film cuts fast and deep, weaving back and forth through time and matching the energy of the coke and rage fueled action on screen. A smart decision, even if the pace early on may leave some confused. Other parts are more methodical, a calm before the storm as characters enjoy the normal life of being with friends, flirting with girls, and snorting coke. Sound helps mediate this difference with upbeat tracks that emphasize the safety of good moments, to the long and tense periods of silence. There is a notable lack of music in tense sequences which expands the suspense beyond any other instrumentals found in the same spots as other films.
What is truly special about the film are the actors, or lack thereof as many were cast from the surrounding favelas. These non-professional actors not only highlight themselves, but the city that has given them this live fast or die hard nature. Even though filming was done decades after the events that take place, favelas are still a prominent and dangerous locations in Rio. More or less making the kids shown in the film the same as those they are portraying, having been born and bred in deep seeded poverty. These kids may find themselves one day in the roles they were cast in, condemned to die for the same reasons they died on screen; because war, war never changes.

title: City of God - The Endless Cycle
author: pauljbuldak
text: Fernando Meirelles and Katia Lund's City of God is a terrific film about living in the slums and the cycle of violence that accompanies it. Many continue to be stuck in the cycle of drugs and violence, while some try to free themselves from it to make a better life. Meirelles and Lund employ fast-paced action right from the beginning. When it starts out, you are left with a lot more questions than answers. After a few scenes, you start adjusting to the quick pace and you start getting your answers. You become invested in the characters that you couldn't keep up with at the beginning. Throughout City of God, you follow Rocket, who also narrates the film, in his attempt to make it out of the seemingly endless cycle.

title: City of god is nothing you will never forget
author: kaylynngillespie
text: City of god has everything From the fear of the inevitable to the seemingly unending violence in the film. This movie started with narration, setting up the film for what the unexpected brings: we can hear diegetic sounds of running and guns smacking tables. Meirelles does not prepare his audience for the cyclic violence and unending tragedy within the film.Meirelles attempts to make his audience uncomfortable. This film does an excellent job of highlighting the extreme poverty within Brazil with the diegetic sounds of traffic and clashing knives used to represent violence. The music in the film does an exceptional job of sweeping the audience away and plunging them into the main character (Rocket) world also it plays a large role in this film as it is set in the 60s, 70s, and 80s. When watching films normality subtitles can be distracting but with this film the subtitles pull you into the film even more and emphasizes the film by understanding every word that is said.The film's cinematography and editing are outstanding. Even though it starts out really chaotic, you get used to it and it just shows what happens in extreme poverty within Brazil.the slums and the cycle of violence with in the film is hard to watch but it is needed in this film for so many reason because it shows realism about what is happening to others. Many continue to be stuck in the cycle of drugs and violence, while some try to free themselves from it to make a better life for themself some will never be able to. Really good films recommend watching.

title: City of God
author: ryansporter
text: City of God, directed by Fernando Meirelles, shows the audience the violence and hardships that are faced in the slums of Rio de Janeiro. Meirelles is able to capture the selfishness and greed that thrives in the slums through the eyes of Rocket- the main character that knows the ins and outs of these horrific lifestyles that exist in the City of God. This movie was extremely fast paced, as all of the characters moved swiftly to their destinations. What also helped this fast-paced lifestyle was the music that was played throughout the movie. The music built this suspense that made the audience eager to what would happen next. Through the uses of many different shots including crane, zoom and handheld that if you want to be able to survive in the slum, you have to keep up. Throughout the film we would be following Rocket and his journey through flashbacks and learn more about each character that would pop up with him. I really believe that the sound throughout the film was to show the dark times of the children who are committing terrible acts and the use of diegetic and non-diegetic sounds makes us feel like we are in the slums with them. The use of subtitles throughout the film worried me in the beginning but after a couple minutes, having to read everything the characters are saying makes it feel so much more real. I would rate this film a 7.4/10 as it is not a film for the faint of heart as there is much violence involving children but a film that moves its audience to realize what it is like in the slums of the City of God.

title: Priceless classic
author: Cleyton_melo
text: A great classic without an Oscar, a portrait of the favelas of Brazil that remains to this day among the poorest.

title: Review I wrote for Comparative Civilizations 12
author: ryna_m
text: "City of God" left me feeling stunned, naïve and slightly guilty about my lack of knowledge concerning situations like the slum gangs of Rio de Janeiro. The characters seemed to exist with a sense of careless brutality. They were a generation of children, adolescent boys, and young men so used to the violence around them that they had become desensitized. I was expecting to feel extremely emotional by the end, simply because of the amount of graphic violence the film contained and the final death toll, but instead I was left with a surprising sense of detachment. To me though, the gang mentality seemed exactly that: detached, emotionally disconnected from reality and trapped in a vicious cycle of urban violence. It was particularly disturbing to see, for example, a group of boys perhaps nine to twelve-years old, walking calmly about the streets with guns in their hands and discussing the next person they would have to kill to better their lives. This film also highlighted widespread corruption within the Brazilian police force, showing cops eagerly taking bribes from gang members instead of making arrests. The movie managed to successfully inform me of a raw hostility found in many of these favelas or slum cities, but the characters did seem to be a bit romanticized for emotional impact. Visually, "City of God" was very realistic and compelling, the filming executed in such a way that the viewer would have to fight not to be pulled into the horrifying action. Although the rapidly advancing plot and large number of actors involved made this movie somewhat hard to follow at times, the general effect was very captivating and thought-provoking, and the ending seemed to come much too soon.

title: how things are
author: black-pookie
text: It reflects well the life of low and high profiles in crime in Brazil. Genuinely shoot and with good actors and photography. It is fun and sad. Written in a way that gets you longing for what's happening next. I don't know how famous these actors are but they were good.

title: a perfect equilibrium..
author: jeanphizz

author: r-25195

title: Who are the complete dunces who gave this movie anything less than 10?
author: something127
text: This movie was and still is my favorite. No one will probably read this comment, its like #42, but I would like to put my two cents in anyway. My brothers and I found this movie in Blockbuster for $2.99. That was the worst ripoff Blockbuster has ever dealt with. That's like giving away heart surgery or something. I would have paid $2.99 to read the back cover. The cinematography was flawless. The storyline, though based on a true story, was an original and brilliant, unlike most movies. I am a Saving Private Ryan fan. The reality in both movies is, well, very real. It makes you feel sorrow when a hero dies, and joy when some triumph for the good guys happens. This is very rare in a movie. I must say, I was very impressed. It proves my theory, that a movie can only be good when the actors, directors, and crew are on the same page, and allow some deviations from the script.

title: The best brazilian movie!!!!
author: manoelalimacedo
text: Despised by the Oscar, it is an almost true construction of the reality that haunts parts of the country. Amazing how it was done! Leandro Firmino interpreting Zé pequeno is wordefull, as well as the Seu Jorge.

title: City of God Review
author: willcholman
text: City of God (or Cidade de Deus) shows life in the slums of Rio de Janeiro from the 1960s to the 1980s. Its aggressiveness and pace help show how the gritty gangs of the time infected the youth and any families close by. The children are the main perpetrators of violence in this movie which is nothing new for cinema, but in this case, the movie is based on a true story. The children are the focus of this movie most of them being introduced young. The characters introduced are all unique and the movie effortlessly shows you how the city changes them and grow up. The Protagonist, Rocket (Buscapé), has higher morals and doesn't want to involve himself in the gang life. He instead wants to become a photographer and when he takes photos of his everyday life in the slums, a big newspaper notices and his talent and ability to take photos in that area earn him a good reputation by the end of the film.

title: Best film
author: carlessileselmejor
text: The film revolves around the, 'City of God,' a favela in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, a horrifying area drug dealers run the community, and where children killing children is not an uncommon occurrence.

title: THE BEST
author: masterdonada
text: O MELHOR FILME QUE EXISTE NO MUNDO SOBRE O MUNDO. Seriously, the way this encapsulates the country is amazing and has amazing sites in Rio, definitely recommend this is you are getting into Brazilian film and definitely look ash the writers other works. Lots of hidden gems in this film.

title: Such a great movie
author: xerato-67810
text: This very long movie is entirely in Portuguese (what I call the devil's language). Yet, you quickly get sucked in and no longer notice you're reading subtitles. The story is more or less that of 2 boys in the hood, one who wants to be a photographer. The other follows a very Scarface-esquire path to rise to the peak of gangsterdom. Oddly, while neither one helps the other on purpose, neither could achieve what they did without the other.

title: Great film
author: pvlvantonnn
text: The other day we reviewed with my husband the film "One plus One (1 + 1)" (2011) and today my review will be about this film.

title: best film I've seen in a long time
author: JMMelo
text: I try to go to the movies as often as I can, but for some reason (time, price, and a little prejudice, I'll admit)I don't get to see as many Brazilian films as I should. Brazilian cinema improved greatly since it came from under the wing of Embrafilme, the national film agency, and Brazilian directors are finally seeing that we can show our reality in a non-cheesy, non-Americanized, non-stereotyped way, while still being smart and commercial.

title: city of god/ city of crimes
author: ugurcankayaci
text: A good movie about crime and children. On the one hand, children who are prone to crime, on the other hand, a child who works for his dreams regardless of the environment and is a photographer. "Two wrongs don't make a right."

title: One of the best movies out there
author: bebelfleck
text: I grew up knowing of this film and hearing how amazing it was. But never did I think it was going to change my life as much as it did. Coming from Brazil this movie shows the problems our people face and the emotions each character faces. If you want a recommendation for a international film this is it. This is the one you need to watch. Ever since I've seen this film I haven't found one that gets to this level. Be ready to cry, get scared and love characters that show the real story of Brazilian people. I love it and I know you will too, and please, don't forget to watch it in Portuguese, so you get the full immersion of the film!

Comparisons to classic "gangster" films like Goodfellas are not without reason, but the context of this movie gives the themes a different meaning altogether.

author: alanroger
text: If you haven`t seen this movie yet, you must run and see. You won`t lose your time and your money. City of God is an amazing and brutal film and I am sure it will win the Golden Globe and the Oscar of the best fereign film. I am shure City of God is the best Brazilian film ever made.

title: I'd give this movie an 11 if I could
author: jamesey
text: The editing, the story, the screenplay, the music...It's all pure brilliance. From the opening scene I was sucked in and I couldnt wait until I could see the finish at the end of the movie. Until then though, there is a terrific story about growing up in 3rd world slums.

title: Knowing more about third world exclusion vicious circle
author: Bouguereau
text: Yes. It is, indeed, a violent film. It`s shocking sometimes. And, sometimes, it is shocking how we betray ourselves laughing when watching some scenes that would make other people cry, or acting normally when situation claim us to react negatively to what we are seeing on the screen. If you feel like this, than maybe you've succeeded in becoming part of City of God`s world. That`s what happens when you live in a reality like this 24 h a day. Violence becomes usual and you start to see things in a different perspective. Or, I could say that, people have to get a life, even when their environment fights against them. Believe me. I live in Brazil, so, in some aspects, I know what it is. What else can I say? Well, just try to watch this movie with an open minded heart. It has a great plot and a great photography, but, to me, the most important of all is that this movie shows the universal problem of exclusion and opression and how things can turn into a vicious circle if there`s no one to break it.

title: Master piece!!!!!!
author: emilioaugusto
text: One of the best brazilian movies, including Central Station (Walter Salles) and Pixote (Hector Babenco)!!It shows a real civil war that we live nowadays in Brazil. Fernando Meirelles made a real masterpiece!! Now Its time to win The Oscar!!! Please, forget Pinocchios...

title: This movie is great!
author: alextfreitas
text: This is one of the best movies of the year, no doubt. Shame on the academy for not even indicating for an Oscar, it definitely deserved one. The violence is shocking, but not less present than 'Private Ryan', 'Gangs of NY', etc. It's even more disturbing because it's based on a true story. Very well made and keeps you interested the whole time. Go watch it!

title: Beautifully told story w/ an intricately woven plot and a barage of interesting/real characters.
author: WyldStallyn
text: I had the priviledge of seeing this movie at the Telluride Film Festival this year and immediately fell in love. I believe it was the best film shown there - even better than 'Bowling for Columbine' or 'Frida'(although these were very, very, good). Its twisted storyline and large number of characters identified only by gang nick-names, is reminicent of movies like 'Pulp Fiction,' 'Resovior Dogs' or 'Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels/Snatch'(because 'Lock, Stock...' and 'Snatch' are essentially the same movie). In fact, when recommending it to friends, I describe it as "A Brazilian Guy Ritchie/Tarantino-esque Film(yes, you can quote me on that)." City of God's description of the corrupt city near Rio de Janero is very strong and persuasive. Its actors seem like they are not acting at all - which is in fact, true. The director went to this city and offered the natives acting lessons as simple classes they could take. But, in reality, he was really holding auditions for the film! Genious idea if you are trying to capture reality instead of bringing in fake, over-aged, Hollywood, no-talent models, putting them in native clothing, placing guns in their hands and expecting them to do the job. "But enough of my yackin'," as Rob Reiner narrates in 'This is Spinal Tap,' go out and see what a call a foreign masterpiece for yourself.

title: Masterpiece!
author: seyhmusergin
text: One of the most convincing, exciting and sensational gang-drug-growth movie of all time. After you see that film, you won't be able to stand workaday,mediocre films of this genre.

title: Drugs murder and love
author: erkas
text: City of God take us into the 60-70´s Ghettos of "Rio de Janiero". A place where young gangsters are gods. Its a true story about a boy called "Rocket", and he decide to not partipate in anything that has to do with crime. This after his big brother who also was a gangster got killed by a little kid. This little kid grow up to be the bíggest ganster in the "City of God". And no matter how much "Rocket" try to stand outside he always run into these gangsters. The only way out of this is the camera. But its also a love story about a young man "Rocket" who sees how all the other guys loose their virginity except him. And how looses his girlfriend to his best friend. The movie i think gives a realistic view how it is to grow up in the ghettos where the fastest way to respect is money. And fastest way to get money is drugs and crime. If you havent seen the movie, i promise you get yourself something to think about afterwards.

title: A new Brazilian Classic: a most excellent, creative film
author: barnhart-3
text: City of God was one of the most thought provoking films that I have seen in years. The movie bears slight resemblance to "Trainspotting" in character although its content is far superior because it is based on real people living out real situations. It gives us a glimpse into human nature in a way that few films have ever attempted. The docudrama-styled filming of the movie transports the audience unconditionally. This film deserves an Oscar!

title: Masterpiece in Cinema
author: jarmuschjones
text: As soon as this movie was over, I wanted to see it again. When I went back to see it a few days later I was disappointed to see that it was already gone. Hopefully it will be released in more theaters soon. City of God jumped immediately to my top ten list of all time. I give this movie a 10 and I've only given maybe five others that score. Great story-This is based on a true story, which always makes a movie more intriguing to me. Great directing-can't wait for his next film. Great acting from a cast of mostly non-professionals-Some characters were very likeable and it was sad when they passed and others you couldn't wait until they got whacked. Awesome cinematography-this stood out from any other movie in a long time, and it alone was worth the 9 bucks. If this is playing near you go see it before anything else, you won't be disappointed. It is pretty graphic and there are a few unsettling scenes of kids killing kids, but I thought that just made the movie that much stronger. Only one word can describe this movie...perfect. So if you can handle a little violence, don't hesitate,go see it..NOW.

title: A "neoverism" dramatic film
author: vincenzomartemucci
text: A film that teaches you in a whirlwind of violence, despair and resignation only those who have a strong conscience and determination survive without killing someone.

title: Magnificent! Superb!
author: giuice
text: In the line of direction of Pulp Fiction (Tarantino) City of God has a suffocating and amused  rhythm, from the start to the end, with an incredible script and direction. I have no doubts, The best film that i have ever seen!!!.

title: outstanding
author: johnmurraylfc
text: Just when you think you have seen it all. This Powerful movie puts Hollywood to shame when you witness something as beautiful this Hypnotic as city of God. It was so easy to be seduced by the Tender Trio,Lil Zeand the lovable Benny The scene with the child was way too close for comfort this is an outstanding piece of art,fast paced twists and turns to a brilliant degree of separation this is the whole reason WHY WE LOVE THE MOVIES go and treat your self funny violent soft and fierce love of survival makes City of God a ten it is a keeper when it comes out on vid/dvd.

title: Some comments
author: joost-schreurs
text: I really liked the movie and I think all the positive things about it are said in the reviews below, but I just couldn't resist adding some criticism to it.

title: Excellent
author: nunoalf
text: it has one of the best movies i ever saw, the actor´s are real and that became one of the many surprises of this film. the picture of the movie is exactly the same of the country ( Brasil ) violence,puberty, good looking women. very good in did.

title: Competes for all-time top honors
author: daarkmonkey-850-544035
text: While perhaps not the best film ever made, City of God clearly competes for top honors. While the heart of the movie is a tragedy about the effects of crime and poverty in the slums of Rio de Janeiro, it does not treat it's viewer as a torture subject. There are many tragedies, both minor and major, that befall the characters. The life in a Rio slum is not portrayed as a fairy tale world, however, there are moments of joy, love, and fun. The script itself would make City of God a great movie, but it was also very well conceived. The camera direction is fast-paced and modern without being overly jumpy, the actors all play their roles naturally, and the production value is incredibly high (especially considering the relatively modest budget.) At once a very serious and thought-provoking film, City of God perfectly balances serious subject matter and a high level of entertainment in a way I have not yet seen any other film achieve.

title: Eye-opening movie
author: rachelfkruger
text: First of all, the acting in this movie was outstanding. Many of the actors came from real situations similar to those in the movie, which made it easier for them to become the character. The way violence was portrayed in this movie was excellent. It showed the mercilessness of the killers and it evoked a sense of reality, unlike average Hollywood violence. The way people were killed made you think: "Wow. These things really happen this way." The relationships among characters, and the characters themselves were very realistic. They weren't stereotypical "Good guys" or "Bad guys." Each one had a complex mix of thoughts, actions, and emotions. The storyline, although very interesting and thought-provoking, was rather complicated. Every so often, the narrator stops the story to explain a character or situation by going back in time, and tells that particular story up until it's the present day, and goes back to the story. Also, due to how many characters are in the movie, it's sometimes hard to keep track of who's who. Especially when the story advances to years later, when characters have grown up, and sometimes change names. All in all, this was a very good movie; one that shows people what the world is really like. It shows how dangerous and depressing slums can be.

title: Fantastic story and direction.
author: darkfo0l
text: A fantastic film, presented in a raw and gripping form. Simply unforgettable. Another great film in the recent few that have shown rough life in southern America. I urge any fans of GREAT FILMS to check this one out. Cop that!

title: Ultimate Film
author: Skyturk92
text: I just finished the movie and all i can say is awesome. Awesome awesome awesome. This movie's director must be a genius that uses amateur players this well. When i saw the crying kid(its not a big spoiler) i doubt that if this is a movie or a real story with a hidden cam. I didn't read the novel but if its better then movie, then that will be the ultimate book. I won't tell the main story but know only this. You will never regret that 2 hours. But be warned, watch this movie extremely carefully from the beginning to the end, because the names can be mixed because they are talking in Portuguese i think, and they are telling the names very differently. Names are a whole another story. So you have to watch this movie without giving any break. My last word again is, awesome.

title: Just a short comment...
author: cknalha
text: It's just the best brazilian film, of all the times! É simplesmente o melhor fime brasileiro, de todos os tempos!

title: One of the best non-hollywood films out there
author: veskoukisandreas
text: One of the most iconic movies of all time. This is a must see for anyone that wants to broaden their views and watch something otherr than the typical hollywood production.

title: So real that frightens.
author: manjarin69
text: The film is really good. I have suggested it to all my friends, although advising them that the images are one of most violent that i have seen. Not for the blood or the shoots, it is for the protagonists, majority of them children of less than one meter.

title: An eye for an eye makes the whole world blind
author: ihyou50
text: Captivated for 130 minutes. I was riveted and couldn't take my eyes of the screen, constantly wondering what was going to happen next. It was so real and raw that you do not think that these are actors at all, they are dregs in the slums of Rio De Jeniro. I am convinced that Lil' Ze is in fact a homicidal gangster thirsty for power who will do anything to keep control and his rule with an iron fist, or brass knuckles. Throughout this whole movie you will see the pattern: for every action is a reaction...tit for tat, you killed my brother now I'm gonna f*ck you over, you insult me I'm going to humiliate you, you killed my Dad now I'm gonna join this gang and exact revenge. Overtones of power struggle and egoism that plague humanity on the deepest levels not just in the ghetto's of Brazil but here in present day Detroit or New Orleans, Atlanta, LA, etc. As many were killed in City Of God, what did it solve? Nothing, in the end, the two "leaders" were both dead and a new younger gang took over and someone will probably off them and a new more virile gang will replace the last and so on and so on. It's a vicious cycle that youth get caught in but the one boy was able to break the cycle and use his mind instead of fist and become a photographer. Great story and cast. Cannot find one flaw. Edgy true life drama.

title: Entrancing
author: MaryBT2012
text: I watched this film in my Portuguese class and I was amazed! I literally forgot that I was watching the movie in subtitles because I was so drawn in by the storyline. The story is told very well and even the parts that were easy to predict happened in a way that kept my attention. The movie starts out showing a scene in which Rocket thinks he is being chased, although the scene doesn't make sense until much later it introduces the most memorable quote in the movie: If you run they will chase you, if you stay they will eat you. After watching the movie the truth of this quote reigns supreme. The actors were amazing and it translated well to me even though it's a foreign film. I was happy to see that this movie received several Oscar nominations because it definitely deserved them. Job well done!

title: one of the best movies I have seen for years
author: comfactory
text: unbelieveable... usually the movie that seems like taking 4 hours is claimed like a boring movie. This one is not like that. It so well directed and edited and shooted that it really seems like it is 4 hours long but you as an audience really DO NOT WANT THIS STORY TO END... At least I had that feeling. Great.

title: Chizel my Nizel
author: rubgonzales
text: This was one of my favorite films.  Despite the fact that I don't understand Brazilian and it had English caption I still got into the movie.  Why is it one of my favorite films?  Because it made me laugh, cry, move in my seat, and cringe.  This is exactly what a great film does.

title: High Expectations Fulfilled
author: davelegge
text: I borrowed this film off of one of my friends yesterday, with high expectations having read many reviews complimenting it beyond belief. As he handed it to me i was warned, 'Oh, and by the way its in Brazilian... But there are subtitles'. I stood for a minute wondering if this meant i wasn't going to enjoy it, as his warning sounded exactly as if this meant the film was rubbish. I sat down to watch later on, feeling confused, but high in expectation. I had wanted to see this since it had been released, but it did not come out at my local cinema and i haven't had time to buy it. Five minutes into the film and i felt as if i spoke fluent Brazilian, i no longer realised i was having to read the subtitles, i had become so involved in what was happening on the screen. Great film making tied in with a brilliant story (which is true apparently), and something about managed to set it apart from other gangster movies. Its realism. I felt it happening in reality as i watched it explode on screen. I finished watching it and paused, to think about what i had just seen. I felt completely satisfied. The movie had beaten my expectations by a mile, they had been good... But the film was very good! The Godfather may be the greatest film ever, Goodfellas may be close, and Scarface may be a gangster movie to compete with any other, but City Of God is the best 'gangster' film i have ever seen.

title: A good movie
author: lucky8213
text: I had been reading an article about this movie published in Brazil which could be translated into something like "The Cosmetics of Violence" In this article the writer critizes the filmmakers for glamorizing the violence through slick edits and kinetic camera work.

title: city of god, blown away

text: When i first walked into angelika theatre downtown i didnt know what to expect exept that i heard from a friend of mine that this movie was awsome. as i was watching this i thought to myself, i havent seen a movie this good i cant remember when, seriously, after i saw it and heard this was the directors first work, i couldent believe it. for those who are in dire need to see a truely great film this is certainly for you and the next person over.

title: almost forgot i was watching it movie. it was so real!
author: thesebadstreets
text: i've never seen anything that seemed so real to me. this blew away reservoir dogs, and at one point and time i couldn't imagine anything being as real and actually scary as reservoir dogs. this movie blew me away. just when i thought all of the insanity had faded and the characters would evntually come to their senses, i was back to holding my mouth in disbelief. and to find out at the end that some of the events were based on a true story. this made me so happy to not have had to live in that kind of environment. i've told all of my friends about this movie and i hope they can escape from the buls*** movies that north american media pumps up. real movies lie in the hands of artists and directors that create and bring you to see and make you believe that what they are offering to you is practical or can actually happen. it was hard to believe that something like this could have ever happened, but the perfect set up of the movie looked so god damn real. i felt like i would walk outside to rio and almost forgot i was watching a movie. goddamn! this was so good.

title: Best movie ever
author: aptheking
text: I think City of God is one of the best movies ever because of the storyline and because of the actors. It is a perfect working story you can see again and again and again.

title: Violence and Art (minimal spoiler)
author: spudhalvorson-1
text: The artistry in this movie is colorful, as is the graphic violence. One must wonder in this day and age where art ends and pure visceral contrivance begins. Yet another "based" on a true story films, this movie paints the day to day violence of the 1960-80's slums of Rio DE Janeiro with a eclectic yet predictable color: red. By the end of the movie you are grateful our hero has escaped the pains of his upbringing, but you may be unsure you needed to relive it along side of him. -An artfully crafted film, the director takes us through a series of flashbacks, ending the film from where we began. This of course has been done before, and although I like the directors method of composition, in several sections we actually watch a couple of segments through twice over. Gentlemen, this is not a good date movie.

title: Impressive
author: muratdurmus1992
text: This is one of the best movies ever due to the closeness to the reality of the acting and scenes. I am not sure if this is based on a real story as the movie says, but what I can say is that people still lives the City of God in all over the world. Still, good people and children die for nothing. In Brasil, Middle East, Asia, Africa, people die for nothing. Like, it is shown in the movie, good people die for the benefit of the bad people. It is always been like this in the history and still going on. And the director shows the corruption in the 70s and 80s in Brasil. The story is really catchy and you don't get bored. Acting of the performers is tremendous. From the youngest to the oldest every performer deserves the Oscar.

title: You can't under rate a film like this
author: esteele-1
text: This is a truly fantastic film. The art direction, cinematography and overall style is easily better than any movie up for an Oscar this year. It is unfortunate (due both to the release timing and Oscar timing) that this film was not up for Best Picture.

title: Esteban Bolanos-City of God
author: esteban_24
text: In my Film Appreciation class we just saw the Brazilian movie "City of God" directed by Fernando Meirelles. The movie takes place on the famous Favelas in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The history is about two major gangs in this area that are fighting to gain the control of the business (drugs). This movie includes a lot of action and drama.

title: Outstanding
author: jlorrimer
text: Although a lot of people have commented on the horror of this excellent film, I've yet to read any comments about it's humour. From the opening scene with the escape attempt by the chicken I knew I was going to enjoy this film and like Pulp Fiction and Good Fellas (though I didn't really want to compare) there's enough laugh out loud dialogue (the hot banana?) to pluck you back into the comfort zone and pull your jaw from the floor after the more harrowing scenes. The scenes with Benni are particularly heart warming, although you always kinda know you are being led down a path that will eventually lead to a sticky end. Some people have suggested there's too much realistic violence in City of God. Well .. if you prefer the pantomime violence of films like Lethal Weapon or Beverly Hills Cop then you don't deserve to see films as good as this.

title: Violence is a reality
author: lucia_vf
text: City of God is the name of one of the poorest areas of the glamorous Rio de Janeiro. Despite its name, it seems that God does not usually come that way and it is perfectly normal, because he could go out with a bullet in his head. The film tells the story of two boys that were born in City of God who become two people totally different - one an honest photographer's apprentice and the other a dangerous drug dealer. But the main subject is not poverty or drugs, which are present throughout the film, it is violence.

title: Campbell's quality film: mm mm good.

I'll tell you what...slick characters whose humor is lost in translation, awesome drug-dealing Funk kings...I loved how you know it was "The Sixties" and that this was "Knock Out Ned's Story" And hot damn...the Story of the Apartment was bloody grand. Wasn't what I expected at all...and I think I laughed at the wrong parts, but for once the case didn't lie. "One of the best films you'll ever see." And it was. And I liked it. title: it can be described as well as a dramatic situation

It is very natural for you to feel like in the film's inevitable. I think the most important films be viewed again and again.

title: A great character driven gritty story
author: natalierose7677
text: The story of several boys growing up in Rio De Janeiro, the different paths their lives take but how they also keep intertwining. The subtitles didn't take anything away from this film and it is beautifully acted. The character driven storyline makes you really root for the boys and evoked real feelings of sadness and empathy when I watched it. It is similar to stories such as The Kite Runner, where you see the characters grow and evolve into young men. There are quite a few violent scenes but all are necessary to give a proper insight into the characters' lives and are not gratuitously drawn out. The film is set in the 60's and 70's which provides a few hilarious moments with clothing and scenery.

title: A frightening future
author: seppo-mlkki
text: I saw this film recently in a film studio in a small Swedish town and noted that the makers have in a way surpassed Tarantino. I am very impressed by the cutting an visualization of the story.

author: Dominic-Bueno

At the film, Rocket tell us the history inside of the favela, where the fights between drug dealers, introduce even children in this world, when Li'l Dice became Li'l Zé and started to kill people at his childhood with his his partner but not killer Benny.
