Is no time for love in this film. I think that this movie is the point of start to the Brazilian movies in a worldwide way, And the same time is an icon in latinoamerican cult movie, that you must see.

title: My thoughts of City of God
author: danielnewman595
text: This movie is possibly one of my favorite foreign films that i have seen largely due to its outstanding cinematography, its detailed story, and the degree of shocking realism it was executed with. This movie definitely gives someone like me, who has never been to Rio De Janero, Brazil a taste of how dangerous and poverty stricken the area really is. This movie gives an insiders look of how local kids of Rio De Janero often easily get involved into gang activities such as murder, drug dealing, and drug use at an extremely young age. This movie also shows how one local caught in this mess of violence and drug abuse is able to improve his life and find his way out of this poverty stricken area. I recommend this movie to anyone who does not mind reading subtitles and likes a good gang movie.

title: Real Favela Life
author: NilsZahirovic
text: A movie about the life of a young boy who gets in love with his photocamera. After taking a picture of a famous favela gang, who appears in the local newspaper, he gets the opportunitie to go deeper in the ganglife by taking pictures of the gangsters.

title: "Best film you'll ever see." indeed.
author: mauthausen_st
text: For the 130 minutes of this movie, one is transported into the brazen unyielding world of the slums where the characters live. The cinematography and editing accurately reflect life and the various point of view. Searing orange and yellow landscapes, cold blues and murky shadows- the color palette itself is a visual work of art. Even with the fast paced narration, it still brings a sense of depth, unlike other films where the fast pace and the director's style overwhelm the characterization and heart of the movie.

title: action-packed. don't be deceived by the sexy picture

text: I enjoyed this movie a lot, and it was pretty much what you would expect after seeing the trailer. Lots of gun violence, drugs, pretty nice cinematography.

title: Must watch before dying type of movie
author: tracy_mendiola
text: I'm a tough critic and I never give out 10's to anything because 10's are unicorns, they don't exist. There is always something wrong with any movie no matter how well it is made, except for City of God. Alright, enough with the act. This really is a masterpiece no matter what age you are, where you're from, or what your financial income is, you will find a way to relate and empathize. There is something to be learned from this film not just morally but in a more philosophical way once you get to see all perspectives in the story. I don't want to say too much so just watch the movie and enjoy. :)

title: - "Cidade De Deus?" "IDK" .
author: ariaquie

The best here is the people, the place, the feelings that we all get that we are loved and that we have a amazing life, but then it comes the worst part, that is the peoples mid in here. Everybody thinks so little about themselves and agree even when it's not right, we are so complacent about everything that's wrong here and the others getting well on other people shoulders. I hate the fact that we are so accommodated that not even thinking straight about what's going here and what can we do to change the chaos. To change is never a idea. Sometimes I think Brazilians fear their governments, I don't know why, maybe is because they have a degree in law or any other diploma, so, people here are afraid of other people that they say is smarted than them? So, We will never grow to a strong country. We are ashamed of what we produced and we don't love what we have in here, people give more value to foreign than to each other. I never liked City Of God, I always said that it was too much, but, hey, I watched this film first time when I was twelve years old, so I indeed was too much for a child that the only mean haven seen in her country was what her father said to her, like - "Some mean people robber your uncle cellphone" or, whatever, things that happen everywhere, but What I'm trying to say is - "I'm not proud of this movie" Even if it shows what's the real reality of my country, still it makes me sad. Is nice film, but I always wished it was film in another place. So this is my first review, it's a weak, but I'll try to get better and hey, English isn't my first language.

title: ONE OF THE BEST FROM BRAZIL
author: hernie22
text: It would be rather cheap to tag City Of God "the South American Goodfellas", as if every region of the world is somehow entitled to at least one gangster masterpiece in the freewheeling Scorsese tradition. (Where, you might ask, is the British Goodfellas?) However, since the audience for a two-hour-plus Brazilian movie might not show without some strong encouragement, let's make this clear: City Of God is the South American GoodFellas.

title: The Hype and Acclaim is Real
author: Nabil_alwaili
text: City of God was a study in brutality. Offending all of the senses, the movie proceded in using a multisensory approach to capture the very essence of violence, in every sense of the word. Human beings of every age were tortured and murdered. A main character was depicted inflicting multiple injuries and deaths while laughing hysterically. I had to wonder what the point of the movie was. Any claim to artistic expression evaded me, entirely

title: An excellent depiction of fatalism.
author: truebiger
text: The depicted violence in Cidade de Deus (Meirelles & Lund) – whether within the city or within its characters – gets explained in a variety of different ways but is ultimately presented as something beyond comprehension or escape. While at some points motives are suggested, they appear insufficient to account for the pervasiveness and level of violence. Additionally, all articulated alternatives to violence get eventually undermined.

title: Love this movie
author: hdotross
text: Still one of my all time favorites. Think this movie was the first movie I ever watched all the way through that had subtitles lol. I loved everything about this movie; the story, the characters, the cast, the location and the cinematography. I remember putting the movie in the dvd player thinking it would make good background noise as I attempted to go to sleep while on a road trip. Before I knew it the movie was over and I was still wanting more. Think I had to watch it like 4 more times that month lol. Actually talking about it now makes me want to go watch. If you haven't seen this film I strongly suggest it.

title: Divisor of Waters of Brazilian Cinema!
author: intuospost
text: Amazing to have been part of the post-production of this work of art made 100% in Brazil! Divisor of Waters of Brazilian Cinema!

title: Reality in Brazil
author: turrbo
text: Even though this is a movie and not a documentary. It depicts a reality and the potential of what you should be prepared for if you visit certain countries. This is a excellent movie from the standpoint: It is reality. Gangs on motorbikes ripping purses, wallets, jewelry. To take it a step further motorbike gangs that kill. Its a definite advantage and it is an excellent training movie before going on a trip to visit these types of countries. Its not only the motorbike scenario but also the gang mentality and being super aware of the possibilities. These types of things can also happen in the USA and UK as well as other supposedly friendly countries. This is a movie that enlightens and addresses these factors probably without the intention of doing so. It will help you be more prepared of what to expect and how to prepare and keep you thinking on your toes.

title: BRAZIL'S BEST FILM EVER MADE
author: GUI_TENSOL
text: As a Brazilian filmmaker myself, I attest that Cidade de Deus (City of God) still is, 17 years after its release, the best film we've ever made.

One of the best Foreign language movies i've ever watched, it's amazingly written and performed.

title: A wonderful example of poverty in Brazil and the struggles the citizens face with gangs.
author: mdias-91655
text: This film is not for the faint of heart; it is a very saddening film that puts aspects of the third world in Brazil into a very clear perspective. For an English speaker, like myself, I had to experience the movie through subtitles, but it did not take away from the impact of the film. I would recommend this film to anyone, it is an incredible experience. The film is based on a young boy in the world of Brazil's capital, Rio de Janeiro, and the struggles that himself, his family, and his friends face throughout their lives. The protagonist Buscape, or "Rocket" in the English subtitles, is a young aspiring photographer attempting to make his way out of the slums that his whole life is based around. Within these slums, the gangs in the area are active, and very violent. Rocket gets a hold of a second-hand camera and begins to take charge of his dream to be a photographer. As the gangs in the area become unsettled, and power begins to shift, a violent turf war begins. Rocket, seizing the opportunity, takes pictures of the action as it unfolds around him. He begins to submit his photos to the local newspaper, and winds up getting a job. It is an amazing film experience and really opens the viewers eyes to the challenges of the third world, and how prevalent poverty is, and how it is ignored regularly.

title: The reality, not only of the favela, but of all Brazilian society, is masterfully represented by Fernando Meirelles in Cidade de Deus
author: fernandocarielo
text: City of God is a stunning film, it demonstrates without shame the Relations between the residents of the most marginalized regions of the country:Favelas.In this environment are told stories of love, crime, Revenge and dreams; Such stories involve emotionally, in addition to Instigating a more critical and reflective look at our own society. The directional technique used by Fernando Meirelles is another strong point of the film, its way of presenting the characters in a simple and fast way brings to the film an enthusiastic tone that incites the curiosity and the identification with such personages, providing an exceptional cinematographic experience!

title: SHIZNIT
author: masonhubbard
text: Film was good, better than bamboozled.

title: Ignore the over-sensitive reviewers, ignore the over-hyped praise.
author: o-48828
text: This is a good film, but that's about it. If you were to read the reviews here, you'll see that people say it's the greatest film ever or one of the worst, most disgusting things ever that tests the limits of free expression and is a candidate for censorship.

title: The Review for City of God
author: sanamkhan-66361
text: Normally Brazilian cinema is strong in good comedy but rather unhappy with respect to dramatic films. However, this film is quite different. Most of the action takes place in one of the largest and most dangerous areas of Rio de Janeiro, the so-called "favela" Cidade de Deus (favela is the name that Brazilians give to the slums, where the poorest live, in the midst of total misery). There, people live alongside with crime, knowing that it may be the last day of their lives and having few opportunities to rise in life. In fact, this is not a movie thing, this is reality. The film merely uses reality to stage a story in which two young people take different life paths: one ends up becoming a photographer and the other becomes a drug dealer. These stories are fiction but they are very similar to the lives of immense young people who live in that place. And that's the great advantage of this deeply shocking movie: we know it's all fiction but it could be true.

title: Realism
author: pietroweb
text: Realistic realistic movie brings you into that world It makes you understand what They are the faves that show you live to really see the cocks Realistic realistic movie brings you into that world It makes you understand what They are the navel's that show you live to really see the cocks

title: City of God
author: tmizdrak
text: City of God was a fantastic film that had you on the edge of your seat from the first scene of the movie to the last. The two main characters they follow in the movie is Rocket a boy who does not have passion for the crime life in Rio de Janeiro and the other named Lil Ze who takes the opposite path and becomes a drug dealer. They grew up together when they were young but took completely different paths in their life. The movie does a great job of giving the full story and of all of the different characters in the movie. The movie gives a full backstory and tells the story in only a 2-hour movie which could have been at least 3 with all of the detail and story going into the movie. The details that they show in the movie is so fine that there is not an object out of place. City of God had a lot of mise-en-scene with the placement of a poster or a person in the background. Each shot has important lighting in it like during the dance there are flashing light to show the confusing that is going on during the scene. Also, the scene in the hotel room with the little kid with the blood all over the walls and the pattern of the blood. I recommend this movie to anyone who likes movies that will keep you interested and keep you wanting more. I give this movie an 8/10 and would watch it again to find more details that went into the movie.

title: A real image of brazillian favelas portrait in a genious cinematic view
author: denypub
text: It's amazing how most part of the cast is actual poor people from the real community of Cidade de Deus. They act with such naturalism that makes some of the critiques not take then as relatable. Same as their desumanized behavor. True is that thats the reality in the favelas of the Rio de Janeiro. And if its too hard, too desensetized for you. It should be. And if its unrelatable, its a problem in the audience.

text: One of the best movies of the millennia. Knowing Portuguese really helps understand the perect dialouge that gives the viewer a real feel for the Rio de Janeiro culture

author: livelikekingx

title: In the heart of life,
author: JahyamirellaDumay
text: 'A Spectacular way of exploring reality, with meticulous details well explored in the act '

title: A beautifully confronting work of art.
author: contemptuous_envy
text: Through the eyes of the protagonist, in this case through the camera lens of aspiring photographer, Rocket, a story of violence, drugs and sexual exploit unfolds with an irresistible flair that makes 'City of God (Cicade De Deus)' impossible to ignore.

title: The Ending (BIG SPOILERS)
author: slimtremmer
text: This is a profound film with filmmakers that knew what they were doing. It was such an incredible experience to watch this film. It will stay with me for a long, long time.

title: question
author: jmurray-26
text: Anyone know how true to the "real story" this movie was? I was wonderin because a few events, like Knockout Ned's killer happening to be the son of the guy he killed in the bank, (coincidentally linking it with the point where Ned loses his compunction for killing, making him no worse than Li'l Ze, and therefore propping up the circle of violence.) This seems too dramatically important. I mean some beautiful points were made, but it seems they are made poignant only by placement in the film, not by their content.

title: Brutal and unforgiving
author: twilightsamuraiboy
text: I just saw this new documentary called "Favela Rising" that seemed to be inspired by Fernando Meirelles' powerful and trenchant "City of God". What impressed me about "City of God" was both its urgent social realism and its vibrant, propulsive energy. While the film's stark yet colorful images arrest you, Meirelles' handling of the issues besetting Brazil's slums -- from poverty, lack of access to education and social services, that escalate to violence and the drug trade -- is complex and responsible, but without being preachy. The main character Rocket's camera (apparently representing Meirelles' own lens) seemed to be an impartial witness to the proceedings and thus the violence becomes even more brutal and devastating because it seemed endemic and thoughtless, coming from the film's characters. The name "Ciudade de Dios", the favela where the interweaving narratives in this film are set, could be no further from the truth of the realities in that community.

title: An absolutely amazing film!
author: aicw2
text: Watched it last night and though it was an incredible and powerful piece of cinema. I'd heard a review of it that likened it to a Brazilian Goodfellas and that is about right. The cinematography has exciting pace and it is superbly directed. The film has many separate strands that all intertwine very creatively. There were some truly disturbing scenes in this film, mainly the ones involving young children as killers or victims. However it is an effective portrait of life in that environment and it is very powerfully conveyed. Another film that it is similar to is Boyz In The Hood although I preferred this one. A must see!

title: a must see movie
author: nenen34
text: I saw the movie yesterday it was fantastic.. it had you sitting at the edge of your seat!.. i felt as if i was actually living there and going through what everyone else was going through...Trying not to get killed and surviving.... being so young and realizing the only way to live everyday was to learn the streets. and to always keep your eyes and ears open... you also had to be aware of who was your friend or a foe. it was mind exploding in how easy it was to be a friend or easier to become an enemy by being in the wrong place or time.. when watching the movie, you must pay attention to everything to understand the trail of events

title: One of the best movies Ive ever seen

author: biancalominy
text: This film was introduced to me while in HS and as an adult it still resonates. One of the best films I have ever seen from the cinematography to the story line and more. Please watch.

title: Glorious Raw
author: shubhufreesouls
text: The beauty is in its detailing and its rawness. Awesome screenplay treated in the best manner and captured with its all rawness gloriously. Fan of this masterpiece, kudos to its director and whole cast & crew..
